Title: Distribution Manager (Logistics, Data Analyst)
Desc: The Distribution Manager is responsible for the major activities of the department, from the ordering of the vehicles to the final delivery of these vehicles to the dealership. All with the intention to reach and exceed our company wholesale objectives. You’ll working with a team of employees, to perform tasks which includes ordering vehicles from the factory, managing the relations with our logistic partner, Glovis, while overseeing the company car program. .This position has an exceptional degree of importance all aspects of the organization operation, all actions and decisions must be consistent with general corporate policies and procedures, corporate objectives, provincial and federal law, and sound business practices.** ResponsibilitiesResponsible for the monitoring and reporting of the sales, inventory, logistical and cost control functions of the Distribution Department.Management of Kia’s monthly and yearly wholesale objectives by ensuring the proper mix of models and trims are ordered from the factoryMonitoring their production status, their arrival in the county and timely delivery to the dealerPreparation of the monthly production order and submission to KHQ. Monitoring of our production to ensure KCA inventory needs are met.Liase with KHQ, Glovis, our customs broker, port, MPCA, etc. regarding incoming shipments.Analysis of Logistic related items, days of supply, supply chain flow, port, rail, compound and transport efficienciesMonitor aged inventory status Preparing aged inventory reports by model and trim lineMaintain and report daily, weekly and monthly sales/inventory reports by:Responsible for preparation of the monthly production order and submission to KMC byAssist the Sales department with analysis and reporting of Sales related items as requiredAnalyze Inventory/sales status and make recommendations regarding Sales programsProvide a weekly wholesale estimate to senior management, which details the carlines to be wholesaled for the month, and ensure that is aligned with corporate objectives.Assist in the preparation of the annual department budget, which needs to detail the expenses of the department vehicles and expense that occur in management of such vehicles.** Skills / Knowledge / Experience / Education RequiredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent computer skills – SAP, Logistics OS, Advanced MS Office,Ability to work in a stressful, fast paced environment and maintain a customer service attitudeKnowledge of importation and customs is an assetAttention to detail is a mustAbility to work in a team environmentSelf-motivated, easily adaptable to changing prioritiesMinimum 6 years’ experience, preferably in the automotive logistics industryUniversity DegreePlease apply directly on KIA Canada website (link below):https://www.kia.ca/en/about-kia/careers/job-postings/Distribution-ManagerJob Type: Full-timeSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shift

Title: Senior Analyst-CPG Manufacturer
Desc:
Job Description
   As part of this team, you will work together with our Consumer Packaged Goods clients to cultivate value-added partnership relationships. The goal is to become the primary and leading source of business insights for NielsenIQ’s clients.  As a Senior Analyst, you will add value through a strong understanding of client needs and providing them with the products, services and analytical insights that will help achieve their business goals. The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge in working with data , performing analysis integrating a wide variety of data sources and presenting to clients. You will work within a team environment where you will develop solid relationships with your own team and within the client organization.  The Ideal Candidate Will Have

 Post-secondary degree in Marketing/Business and/or related field
 4+ years of marketing, retail or category management experience
 Strong analytical skills preferably in the CPG or Retail industry
 Demonstrated ability to provide insight into the data and address client business issues
 Excellent communication skills
 Excellent presentation skills
 Strong client relationship building/management skills
 Knowledge of NielsenIQ products and services an asset
 The aptitude to look for ways to challenge the status quo
 Ability to multi-task and capable of independent decision making with a bold, nimble and collaborative approach to problem solving
 Technically fluid with strong data manipulation , Excel skills and the ability to leverage technology as an enabler
 Familiarity with using Power BI and/or Tableau
 Accountable, results driven and open to new ideas and ongoing learning
 Proactively create innovative insights that challenge the status quo
 Strong sales mindset with the ability to influence and build strong client relationships





  Additional Information
  
 About NielsenIQ
 NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.
 NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Title: Store Operations Analyst
Desc:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada by 2022 and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
Reporting to the Manager of Operations Reporting & Analysis, this position will collaborate with the Store Operations team to provide analytical interpretation, analysis, presented recommendations and consultative services to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems.
What you'll do
Responsibilities
Support the business with an analytical skillset, including developing operational reporting and executive dashboards, providing analysis for the business
Manage data, translation of data into actionable insights
Provide findings to all levels of the organization’s leadership in an understandable and compelling manner
Work with business partners to optimize tasks to increase efficiency and accuracy, include driving the design of automation for the business
Build robust and interactive reports to shed light on the performance of various initiatives
Who you are
We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
Effectively anticipate and respond to disruption, while consistently delivering strong performance
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.
What you bring
A post-secondary degree or certificate (business, finance/ commerce) and / or 2+ years of experience in an administrative function with financial or business reporting responsibilities or 2+ years in an analytics function
Proficient with statistical methods and mathematical techniques including predictive modeling, regression, AB testing, cluster analysis, etc.
Advanced Excel skills
Strong problem solving, analytical and strategic thinking skills; can see the "big picture" in a complex business environment
Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences
Demonstrated experience in exploratory data analysis and data mining, processing of large, complex data sets
Comfortable manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources and big data environments
Hands-on experience using business intelligence and statistical analysis tools such as R, Cognos, Micro Strategy, Knime, Alteryx or other
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles
Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines
Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies
Ability to work independently and in an ambiguous environment
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .

Title: Senior Business Analyst (remote)
Desc:
Overview:

At Zebra, we’re reinventing how businesses operate at the enterprise edge -helping them run faster, smarter, and more connected than ever before. We are a dynamic community of builders, doers and problem solvers, we each play a unique role - shaping new technologies, bringing solutions to market, and partnering with companies on the front line of business.
Being a part of Zebra means making your mark as we make digital transformation a reality. It means growing into a leader at a leading company that makes a distinct difference - because together, we’ve only just begun.
The role will require individuals to translate business problems into detailed Business Requirements, User Experience, and Functional Design along with leading the project implementations from concept to adoption in the project cycle. Within the role you will be validating Functional Requirements, creating User Test Scripts, running CRP session, creating Data Migration Plans, delivering Training and providing tools support.
The role will work closely with cross function teams including sales, marketing, finance and sales operations to ensure an integrated experience is provided to our customers.
Responsibilities:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Manage a portfolio of projects within the CPQ and SaaS or CRM space
Define and own the business requirements, design, user stories and business processes for projects for sales and partners
Manage and own the implementation of projects from Concept to Post Go Live Support that are assigned to you
Develop training material, provide training, and drive adoption for projects implemented
Manage a virtual team across the different regions on initiatives
Build Standard Operating Procedures
Research and recommend innovative ways to drive productivity to our sellers
Identify Productivity gaps within the sales tools and drive resolutions
Define communication and change management plans for projects
Create system mocks up to show the art of the possible in the technology
Develop Reports as needed on ad-hoc basis

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree Required. Advanced Degree preferred
12 + years experience with demonstrated ability to interface with all levels of management
Demonstrated ability to manage end user issues
Subject matter expert with technical applications / solutions
Ability to lead teams collaboratively
Overseeing highly complex issues and applying advance root cause analysis
Subject matter expert on applicable IT systems / applications
Ability to design highly complex systems and tools
Oversees management and strategy of documentation processes
Advanced analytical skills
Strategize IT solutions

Title: Business Analyst, Technology
Desc:
About eOne
Entertainment One Ltd. (eOne) is a talent-driven independent studio that specializes in the development, acquisition, production, financing, distribution and sales of entertainment content. As part of global play and entertainment company Hasbro (NASDAQ: HAS), eOne's expertise spans across film and television production and sales; production, distribution and brand management of kids and family properties; digital content; and immersive and live entertainment. Through its extensive reach and scale, and a deep commitment to high-quality entertainment, eOne unlocks the power and value of creativity.
eOne brings to market both original and existing content, sourcing IP from Hasbro’s portfolio of 1500+ brands, and through a diversified network of creative partners and eOne companies including: international feature film distribution company Sierra/Affinity; unscripted television production companies Renegade 83, Daisybeck and Blackfin; live entertainment leaders Round Room Live; and award-winning emerging content and technology studio Secret Location.
As a Business Analyst, you will join Entertainment One’s Information Technology team to ensure process mapping, requirement gathering, data analysis, relationship management, and project and/or operational support.
Key Responsibilities:
Create and document Business Requirements, gap analysis and support documents for projects related to Entertainment One’s Strategic Initiatives.
Analyze and synthesize stakeholder requirements into actionable items.
Facilitate stakeholder engagement through interviews, workshops, meetings, and/or training.
Submit technology estimation (cost benefit analysis) documentation and provide to clients in order to facilitate feasibility assessments on project initiatives.
Act as a liaison between business and technology groups.
Provide initiative documentation as deemed necessary.
Ensure business and system requirements are documented in the form of detailed functional and non-functional requirements and business designs, which meet industry best practices and are consumable by clients, development and testing.
Provide operational support following the change management process.
Research existing policies, procedures, methodologies and systems that support the current state and identify changes needed to support revised processes. Work with business and process engineering to identify and build process improvements into design.
Utilize creative thinking to modify or select the most suitable procedure/approach that results in providing eOne with optimum solutions to business and technology challenges
Lead requirement gathering and other sessions with Stakeholders, to capture the requirements and specifications.
Using negotiating and facilitation skills, resolve issues across competing segments and channels to arrive at solutions that meet the needs of all stakeholders. Actively manage client expectations on the BA work package and the initiative overall where providing support.
Work with the technology team to ensure understanding of the business requirements, use cases and business designs, and obtain sign off on the various elements to ensure solution delivery is appropriate and meets the needs of the business.
Support the work packages for the Development, Testing, Communication, Learning, and Implementation teams by conducting walkthroughs, providing clarification and facilitating issue resolution.
Conduct user training.
Business Planning and Tracking - Meet business requests within budget, on time, and within acceptable quality levels. Manage assigned work packages against timelines and within scope and budget; make recommendations on corrective actions if work package deliverables are in jeopardy. Create change requests as required. Document and raise issues for resolution encountered during the requirements definition process.
Work for consensus and contribute to achievement of team/group goals.
Provide support in RFP process and vendor management.
Continuous Improvement - Work to provide continuous improvement of and ensure high level of quality in all deliverables, processes and procedures.
Communication - Create organized and professional presentation material for clients and partner stakeholders, presenting recommendations in a logical, articulate and influencial manner. Facilitate and lead discussions as required, preparing documentation to record discussion and follow-up actions.
Key Competencies:
Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who will be delivering solutions that meet our internal clients' changing needs.
At least 5 years of Business Analysis experience.
Well-developed analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
Experience in business requirements documentation.
Experience in Use Case creation.
Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills.
Well-developed writing skills sufficient to create and precisely articulate requirements, ideas, and opinions.
A University degree in business and/or information technology (or equivalent work experience) is an asset.
Certified business analyst professional or equivalent work experience (preferred).
Demonstrated success in delivering initiatives across multiple business units in a matrix environment.
Extensive experience with all aspects of Requirements Management: Business Process Modeling, Use Case modeling, use case specifications, functional and non-functional requirements and interface design.
Demonstrated ability to build relationships, work collaboratively, and resolve problems with people at all levels in the organization, across lines of business and with third party vendors.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, negotiation and mediation skills.
Self-driven and someone who takes ownership.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
MS Visio experience.
MS SharePoint experience (preferred).
Previous Finance system implementation experience (preferred)
What you’ll be a part of:
Break time: free snacks, winter holiday office closures, reduced hours in summer
Party time: office bar carts, after work drinks, holiday and summer parties, and sometimes just because
Be inspired: regular film screenings, concerts, and opportunity to get involved in industry events
The office: modern facilities, in house screening rooms, more snacks, and swag
Build a better world: transcend entertainment to our corporate social responsibility activities. Plan a social event.
Promote healthy lifestyles. Go green. Give back.
Grow: develop your career and shape your future
We thank everyone for their interest but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Entertainment One is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities and supporting diversity and inclusion within our work environment. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. #LI-Hybrid

Title: Senior Forest Analyst
Desc: Can you bridge the gap between the business of forestry and the information/data/analysis required to support informed decision making? Are you analytical by nature and understand data, statistics, and a range of analytical tools?Forsite is looking for a Senior Forest Analyst (Edmonton) with solid communication skills to support our clients in Western Canada. The successful applicant will become a key team member supporting the delivery of strategic planning and landbase analysis projects. The position requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience, a post-secondary education with a natural resource management focus and professional forester accreditation (or eligibility).Forsite is a dynamic forest management services company serving government and industry clients since 1987. We are a collaborative project-focused organization that strives to provide opportunity for our employees and value for our clients. Forsite has been SAFE certified since 2007 and is committed to providing a safe work environment.Working within Forsite’s Resource Management and Technology business area you will lead and work with project teams to provide forestry business knowledge and technical analysis that offers cost effective, innovative, and meaningful solutions. You will have exceptional problem solving, written and oral communications skills with an ability to translate complex analysis results into practical knowledge that supports informed decision making.Potential project types include forest management planning, timber supply analysis, cumulative effects analysis, landbase reporting for timber and non-timber resource values, carbon reporting / management strategies, economic viability and operability, inventory projections, growth and yield analysis, strategic silviculture investment analyses, etc.The ideal candidate will have a background in operational forestry, strategic planning, timber supply, growth & yield tools, and GIS analysis. You must have excellent data manipulation skills using databases, geodatabases, and scripting languages (SQL, Python, etc).You will be expected to produce clear written and verbal communications to document project inputs and explain project results.Forsite is looking for the most suitable individual for the position available with the skills and knowledge to effectively complete the duties required of the position. Applications are welcome from anyone. At Forsite, we foster and sustain an environment of diversity & inclusion where everyone can reach their full potential.Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Marketing Science Analyst
Desc:
Marketing Science Analyst

As a Marketing Science Analyst, your curiosity never ends. The next question is always on your mind, helping you to understand how marketing science fits in the big picture of a project. You bring in 1 to 3 years of experience, owning marketing science deliverables across a broad range of initiatives, and focusing on at least two of the following areas: tracking and measurement, implementation, reporting, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration, or statistical modeling. You understand the nature and purpose of the main Digital marketing channels, enjoy collaborating with others, and are able to communicate clearly and effectively.

You will:

Analyze data for insights and identify methods to improve processes.
Design, build and automate analyses, reports, dashboards and other deliverables.
Assist in the ideation, development and execution of measurement strategies and frameworks.
Gather data through various third-party platforms and ensure compliance with data governance protocols.
Communicate complex analysis in an effective, easy-to-understand manner
Implementation:
Define, implement and validate tracking tags/codes across multiple digital platforms.
Statistical Analysis:
Assist in the ideation, development and analysis of A/B and multivariate testing.

You have:

B.S. degree in a quantitative or technical field. Including but not limited to: economics, mathematics, business, finance, social sciences, computer science, or information management. M.S. degree preferred.
Advanced Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office skills, with top notch communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with one or more digital advertising/analytics platforms: CM360, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google Analytics etc.
Experience with one or more visualization platforms (e.g.: Tableau, Domo, PowerBI, etc.).
Ability to efficiently communicate deliveries and delays of project with follow-ups as needed.
A drive to keep learning and offer your team support to grow and learn.
Data engineering/architecture:
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, or other business-relevant statistical and database programming language.
Media/Marketing:
Reporting or analytics experience with at least 2 media platforms (e.g.: Google Campaign Manager, Google Ads, Facebook Insights, Search Ads 360, etc.).
An understanding of the media landscape.
An understanding of Customer Relationship Management (CRM), and how its activities are planned and executed.
An understanding of Market Research, its principles, and how it is planned and executed.

Title: Business Analyst
Desc:
Business Analyst - ( 22000191 )
Description
Grow with the best. Join a smart, innovative, and inspired team that strives for growth and operational excellence. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 25,000 team members in over 400 locations worldwide are vital to making our Company stronger.
As data continues to grow in size and complexity, we need more robust tools to help clients manage, understand, and interact with it. Our focus centers around developing strategy alongside client needs and using software as a platform to deliver value and centralize insights across services. Software and digital strategy are the solutions that bridge the data to knowledge gap to deliver insights and analytics for clients to stay on top of the information that matters most and ultimately drive efficiencies in the operations of their assets.
Our shared focus is to combine digital transformation, modern visualizations, user experience design, data contextualization, and narrative science to help clients reach their full potential. Stantec is ranked No. 10 on the Top 150 Global Design Firms list by Engineering News-Record (ENR) and No. 10 on the Top 300 Architecture Firms list by Architectural Record, both leading industry publications. We want our digital practice to enter this upper echelon as well and it is our vision within the Water business line to increase awareness of Stantec as a global leader for digital solutions.
Your Opportunity
We are seeking a Business Analyst to increase our capacity in product development and delivery. Stantec’s Digital Practice in our Water business line works closely with account managers and clients to develop and deploy top tier digital solutions. This work includes gathering requirements, developing user stories, and managing agile product development. Our goal is to transform the water industry with best-in-class digital solutions. These solutions cover the complete project and water lifecycle, from planning to operations, and watershed management to wastewater treatment. Frequently they extend to asset management and regulatory compliance.
Stantec’s Digital Practice in our Water business line works closely with product owners and development leads to develop solutions with top tier information access and analytics. This journey includes identifying, defining, developing, delivering, and supporting those products. This role is primarily focused on the product development stage of that journey.
This role will include working with multiple software development teams. Collaboration with other Digital Practice leadership, product owners, and development teams is anticipated. The ideal candidate will have experience as a business analyst and managing development as an agile lead.
Your Key Responsibilities
Do: Project Delivery
Scrum master experience and well versed in agile / scrum ceremonies.
History of successfully working as a business analyst in an agile environment.
Gather critical information from meetings with stakeholders and be able to create meaningful requirements and document thoroughly.
Evaluate business processes, elicit requirements, and perform requirements analysis.
Collaborate with UX designers during the interface design stage.
Extremely organized and be able to develop a ground structure of existing requirements.
Be able to develop a solid requirements structure, document requirements, acceptance criteria and review test cases for testing team.
Ensure that solutions/requirements meet the business needs and are in alignment with system constraints.
Perform quality assurance testing and help business team in performing user acceptance testing as required.
Be able to produce required documentation for releases, create change proposals, and provide an organized structure.
Lead: Agile Product Development
Ability to lead and manage all aspects of agile / scrum product development life cycles
Able to negotiate with project sponsors when roadblocks occur during development
Support and educate the Project Sponsor , especially on grooming and maintain the product backlog.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and the technical team.
Review team’s work and provide technical guidance on development approach and challenges
Conduct work in a safe manner and promote health and safety within the office and outside of the office while visiting clients and job sites.
Effectively challenge and inspire staff to work together (even if we are apart) within our Water Digital Solutions business and being accessible to our staff.
Innovate: Develop and Deploy Innovative Solutions
Ability to lead and collaborate in project team setting and to engage in creative and critical thought.
Recommend solutions by identifying problems and understand the business problem & need.
You will be receiving direction from Digital Practice leadership in various locations and working with teams in remote locations.
Qualifications
Capabilities and Credentials
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts in writing and verbally.
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
Excellent documentation skills and analytical/critical thinking
Candidates must be well organized, self-motivated, and enjoy finding solutions to problems.
This role may require some travel to attend meetings with clients and dev teams.
Proven experience with application development, quality assurance, and testing methodology.
Experience with environmental compliance and built infrastructure, including real time data, operational technologies, and regulatory compliance.
Understanding of technology areas like API, Swagger, Postman
Experience with Jura, Microsoft Azure or AWS cloud-based application development and deployment. Experience with Microsoft SQL is a plus.
Experience in working with clients to ensure satisfaction with deployed products.
Experience overseeing and directing support of digital products.
Familiar with the ITIL framework
Familiar with Project Management Institute Standards
Can work well in a distributed team environment without direct supervision.
Technology knowledge and understanding of IT industry best practices.
Experience working in a consultant role is preferred.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in software development performing requirements gathering, elaboration, story creation, acceptance validation, and agile management of teams.
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.
Primary Location : Canada-Alberta-Edmonton

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer
Desc:
Make a difference
Our Business Intelligence team is still growing! Are you passionate about Business Intelligence and looking for an opportunity to join a growing team within an organization that invests in its communities? Do you have experience in software development for business intelligence in a Microsoft environment? If so, we want you! We are searching for a collaborative and strategic developer who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. You will have the opportunity to join our new data-focused team on one of our organization’s largest and most impactful initiatives!
This position reports to the Manager, Business Intelligence within the Information Technology and Services (ITS) department of TCHC. Performing in a senior role, this position supports both existing business software systems and develops new ones, as authorized by client business groups through ITS management. This position is involved in all areas of BI systems development, from business concept to implementation.
TCHC is currently going through a major transformation of one of its main tenant management system to an integrated cloud based housing management solution where upwards of 40 systems will be migrated to the new system. ITS is also building out a new BI roadmap to create a unified BI strategy to provide analytics and future BI capabilities.
What you’ll do
Works with internal clients to gather business requirements and evaluates data requirements by using data profiling to create source to target data mappings
Translates user requirements into technical architecture vision and implementation plans, going from design to implementation to production support
Designs data models including customized business dimensions, facts and measures to support scorecard and self-service reporting needs
Designs databases using star, snowflake, normalization techniques required for data modelling
Designs cube projects (SSAS / Tabular) including cube hierarchies, partitioning, processing and loading strategies
Ensures consistent use of internal information architecture standards
Uses Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services, Integration Services, Reporting Services and Power BI to develop interactive dashboards, data visualizations, balance scorecards and other analytics for self-service BI solutions
Designs, develops and maintains the Extract Transformation And Loading (ETL) programs required to build BI solutions
Develops BI reports, dashboards and analytics to support TCHC’s corporate business ensuring optimal performance and availability
Builds a data pipeline to enable data integration from disparate, large data sources. Drives collection of new data, refinement of existing data sources, working with Data Governance to ensure compliance of data standards
Performs ad-hoc database migrations, upgrades, installations, configurations, troubleshooting and monitoring of SQL Server databases
Assists with BI project work efforts estimation
Develops detailed technical specifications, User Guides and ETL documentation including training of users
Serves as Subject Matter Expert in BI tool development concepts
Researches into the current state of BI marketplace to make recommendations and selection criteria for the procurement of new BI tools and technologies
Coordinates and supports development efforts of technical and corporate staff with database tuning efforts as well as ongoing application implementation, support and upgrades
Supports production issues and maintenance as necessary – acting as second level support for troubleshooting and resolving BI related applications / databases
Participates in BCP and DR planning, ITSM process improvement, run book creation and service catalog updates

What you’ll need
University degree or equivalent
University degree in computer science or a relevant technical discipline preferred
5 years’ experience in designing / architecting high performance ETL programs using T-SQL and SSIS, developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using Microsoft technologies (SSRS reports, SSAS / Tabular cubes, Power BI), building data warehouses, analytics, and dimension modeling using IDE tools such as Visual Studio, Eclipse or Jupyter Notebook
3+ years’ experience with master data management, development on big data platforms (Hortonworks, Cloudera or Azure) and languages such as Python, R or SPARQL
3 years’ experience with data modeling multidimensional and tabular models, data management, data migration, data cleansing and synchronization and working with business clients directly by consulting with them to gather requirements to deliver projects
Experience working with various forms of data infrastructure including SQL Server, Hive, Impala and column-oriented databases such as Cassandra, MongoDB etc.
Experience with Hadoop modules such as HDFS, MapReduce, Hive, YARN, HBASE and Oozie
ITIL certification
Demonstrated knowledge about business intelligence, the use of BI and analytics to improve business operations
Demonstrated knowledge of multidimensional and tabular data models
Demonstrated ability to create standards and go from design to implementation
Demonstrated capable of performing SQL Server database backups, restores and patching on Windows environments
Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to present to client groups, to consult with technical and non-technical staff and to prepare reports and proposals  Must be able to handle multiple priorities in a fast paced environment
Excellent organizational skills to deliver projects on-time and on-budget
Excellent interpersonal and conflict resolution skills, sensitivity and tact
Demonstrated experience with working on large scale and multiyear initiatives
Demonstrated experience with Microsoft BI stack
Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Azure, Power BI or other modern BI tools
Demonstrated experience building SSAS / Tabular cubes and Power BI dashboards / reports against such cubes
Demonstrated experience in building / designing / maintaining a SQL Server data warehouse
Has worked in large data migration projects
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with Hadoop, Hortonworks HDP and Linux server environment is a plus
Experience with social housing management is a plus
Excellent analytical skills, able to manage multiple projects under strict timelines, work well in a demanding dynamic environment and meet overall objectives
High level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity
High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision

What’s next
Once you apply, we’ll review your resume and cover letter to determine if your skills and experience match the qualifications for the role. Only qualified candidates will be contacted to move forward in the hiring process. If you are contacted, the process will include one or more interviews and/or assessments and reference checks.
Candidates for unionized positions must score a minimum of 70% to pass any interview or assessment and be considered for the next stage of the recruitment process. Successful candidates will be determined based on score and where applicable, union seniority. Note: not all candidates who score 70% or higher will automatically proceed to the next stage of the recruitment process as this will be dependent on the number of candidates and number of available roles.
Please Note: TCHC has a mandatory vaccination policy wherein staff are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of November 23, 2021 with the exception of employees with approved accommodations.

Title: eCommerce Analyst
Desc:
Knw
Job Purpose
The rapid digitization of marketplace is creating the need to accelerate and reshape the ways of working and technologies used to enhance and stay competitive to be relevant and successful. eCommerce is not a channel; in fact, it is just a future state of business. This position will play a key role in accelerating the digital transformation across brands and customers.
Key responsibilities
Determining the company's e-commerce goals and KPIs.
Identifying key areas for improvements, with respect to each Strategic eCommerce Pillars
Monitoring and analyzing e-commerce metrics and figures.
Transforming e-commerce data into operational insights.
Researching competitors, alternative markets, and opportunities in the e-commerce space.
Brainstorming ideas to enhance and transform the company's e-commerce approach.
Developing e-commerce solutions in conjunction with marketing, sales, supply chain, SRM and IT personnel.
Implementing broad e-commerce strategies to assist our business development goals.
Reporting and acting on changes and market trends. Staying close to the changing shopper behavior, leading panel studies.
Future proofing the business in a data driven manner
Advising various business stakeholders on e-commerce related matters
What we are looking for:
A bachelor's degree in business management, marketing, or data science.
A minimum of 4 years’ experience in digital economies and e-commerce.
In-depth understanding of web-analytic tools, such as Google Analytics, Heap, Oracle, Power BI and OWOX BI.
Experience with Predictive Analytics tools like Tableau
Experience with Digital Shelf Analytics platforms like EDGE, Profitero, e.fundamentals, Salsify Insights etc.
Knowledge with various Canadian retailer data sources
Knowledge of important e-commerce terminology and measures.
Highly organized, analytical, and technically minded.
Proficient in various data analysis techniques and procedures.
Excellent report writing and presentation abilities.
Able to orient data analytics insights with the end-user in mind.
Professional, punctual, and goal-driven.
A team player with great communication skills.
Familiarity in setting up APIs can be a value add

Title: Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
Desc:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Fas Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
Position Title: Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
Team and Location: Risk & Controls – Calgary, AB or Remote
Position Summary:
Reporting to the Senior Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit), the Analyst will assist with the IT compliance activities, across Parkland’s various businesses and operations, including IT, business transformation and integration initiatives.
The successful candidate will bring a commercially focused, value-add, risk management mindset and demonstrate a track record of ‘thinking outside of the box’ and driving significant innovation in the delivery of compliance audits.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist with developing and maintaining the IT Risk Assessment and scoping for Parkland; including identifying areas where compliance audits should focus.
Assist with execution of Parkland’s IT compliance program (C-SOX and SOX) including execution of walkthroughs and tests of design and operational effectiveness of IT controls. These include:
Assist with annual and ongoing compliance scoping to identify any changes to the systems, applications, and automated controls considered to be in-scope for the current fiscal year.
Prepare clear, concise, appropriately referenced work papers to document test procedures performed and conclusion drawn.
Pre and post- implementation reviews of system implementations or enhancements.
Coordinate IT compliance program testing IT controls with external audit IT team members, control owners, managers and executive Management.
Evaluate IT control deficiencies for impact and perform root cause analysis to determine appropriate Management actions.
Monitor Management’s remediation efforts to closure, including review of supporting evidence.
Support initiatives to improve controls, make processes more efficient, effective, and/or reduce cycle time for IT compliance.
Perform various other reviews of IT management policies and procedures such as change management, business continuity planning/ disaster recovery and information security to ensure that controls surrounding these processes are adequate.
Bring good understanding of IT Controls methodology to help the department develop a “best in class” practice.
Assist with the implementation of data analytical tools to perform sampling, analyze data to improve audit and business efficiency and effectiveness, (including for risk assessments).
Support the maturation of IT Compliance program across the organization.
The team is to be regarded as a business partner when reviewing and developing procedures for the business. Policy and procedure research and development is required as well as review and recommending refinements.
Qualifications and Skills:
Minimum 3 years of relevant SOX and C-SOX IT controls experience.
Good knowledge and experience of IT General Controls across domains such as access, change management, operations, application controls and reports testing.
Experience with application of data analytics and visualization (preferred).
Ability to build relationships with business customers.
Ability to manage confidential content.
Strong attention to detail and follow-up.
Ability to work under pressure, resolve problems and make decisions quickly and effectively, using a strong sense of self confidence.
Certified Information System Auditor (CISA) with Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) is considered an asset.
Moderate knowledge of accounting practices (preferred).
High energy: Self-motivated with the ability to effectively manage concurrent projects.
We Offer:
Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.
Please note:
Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Business Analyst
Desc:
Business Analyst - ( 22000191 )
Description
Grow with the best. Join a smart, innovative, and inspired team that strives for growth and operational excellence. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 25,000 team members in over 400 locations worldwide are vital to making our Company stronger.
As data continues to grow in size and complexity, we need more robust tools to help clients manage, understand, and interact with it. Our focus centers around developing strategy alongside client needs and using software as a platform to deliver value and centralize insights across services. Software and digital strategy are the solutions that bridge the data to knowledge gap to deliver insights and analytics for clients to stay on top of the information that matters most and ultimately drive efficiencies in the operations of their assets.
Our shared focus is to combine digital transformation, modern visualizations, user experience design, data contextualization, and narrative science to help clients reach their full potential. Stantec is ranked No. 10 on the Top 150 Global Design Firms list by Engineering News-Record (ENR) and No. 10 on the Top 300 Architecture Firms list by Architectural Record, both leading industry publications. We want our digital practice to enter this upper echelon as well and it is our vision within the Water business line to increase awareness of Stantec as a global leader for digital solutions.
Your Opportunity
We are seeking a Business Analyst to increase our capacity in product development and delivery. Stantec’s Digital Practice in our Water business line works closely with account managers and clients to develop and deploy top tier digital solutions. This work includes gathering requirements, developing user stories, and managing agile product development. Our goal is to transform the water industry with best-in-class digital solutions. These solutions cover the complete project and water lifecycle, from planning to operations, and watershed management to wastewater treatment. Frequently they extend to asset management and regulatory compliance.
Stantec’s Digital Practice in our Water business line works closely with product owners and development leads to develop solutions with top tier information access and analytics. This journey includes identifying, defining, developing, delivering, and supporting those products. This role is primarily focused on the product development stage of that journey.
This role will include working with multiple software development teams. Collaboration with other Digital Practice leadership, product owners, and development teams is anticipated. The ideal candidate will have experience as a business analyst and managing development as an agile lead.
Your Key Responsibilities
Do: Project Delivery
Scrum master experience and well versed in agile / scrum ceremonies.
History of successfully working as a business analyst in an agile environment.
Gather critical information from meetings with stakeholders and be able to create meaningful requirements and document thoroughly.
Evaluate business processes, elicit requirements, and perform requirements analysis.
Collaborate with UX designers during the interface design stage.
Extremely organized and be able to develop a ground structure of existing requirements.
Be able to develop a solid requirements structure, document requirements, acceptance criteria and review test cases for testing team.
Ensure that solutions/requirements meet the business needs and are in alignment with system constraints.
Perform quality assurance testing and help business team in performing user acceptance testing as required.
Be able to produce required documentation for releases, create change proposals, and provide an organized structure.
Lead: Agile Product Development
Ability to lead and manage all aspects of agile / scrum product development life cycles
Able to negotiate with project sponsors when roadblocks occur during development
Support and educate the Project Sponsor , especially on grooming and maintain the product backlog.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and the technical team.
Review team’s work and provide technical guidance on development approach and challenges
Conduct work in a safe manner and promote health and safety within the office and outside of the office while visiting clients and job sites.
Effectively challenge and inspire staff to work together (even if we are apart) within our Water Digital Solutions business and being accessible to our staff.
Innovate: Develop and Deploy Innovative Solutions
Ability to lead and collaborate in project team setting and to engage in creative and critical thought.
Recommend solutions by identifying problems and understand the business problem & need.
You will be receiving direction from Digital Practice leadership in various locations and working with teams in remote locations.
Qualifications
Capabilities and Credentials
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts in writing and verbally.
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
Excellent documentation skills and analytical/critical thinking
Candidates must be well organized, self-motivated, and enjoy finding solutions to problems.
This role may require some travel to attend meetings with clients and dev teams.
Proven experience with application development, quality assurance, and testing methodology.
Experience with environmental compliance and built infrastructure, including real time data, operational technologies, and regulatory compliance.
Understanding of technology areas like API, Swagger, Postman
Experience with Jura, Microsoft Azure or AWS cloud-based application development and deployment. Experience with Microsoft SQL is a plus.
Experience in working with clients to ensure satisfaction with deployed products.
Experience overseeing and directing support of digital products.
Familiar with the ITIL framework
Familiar with Project Management Institute Standards
Can work well in a distributed team environment without direct supervision.
Technology knowledge and understanding of IT industry best practices.
Experience working in a consultant role is preferred.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in software development performing requirements gathering, elaboration, story creation, acceptance validation, and agile management of teams.
Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best.
Primary Location : Canada-Alberta-Edmonton
Other Locations : Canada

Organization : BC-1322 Innovation-SIA IBO-Canada
Employee Status : Regular
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Travel : No
Schedule : Full-time

Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.

A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.
Please note:
Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Senior Studio Business Analyst
Desc:
Company Description
SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kidswear, and Everything Else.
SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.

Job Description
Reporting to the Associate Manager of Planning, the Senior Studio Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing requirements to support all projects and strategic initiatives across Studio operations. This role will directly partner with various business units to help develop long-term strategies in key initiatives that drive growth and profitability improvements. The Senior Analyst is responsible for formulating clear recommendations on how to improve internal processes, and enhance our production by mapping out processes and analyzing data from various sources. The ideal candidate will work cross-functionally, embrace coaching and have a collaborative style, with the ability to influence and motivate to drive performance results.
Reporting & Forecasting (40%)
Actively participate in assessing current and future data needs that can scale with the the business
Establish key performance indicators, and streamline and improve internal and external reporting dashboards to provide visibility to the business on operational performance, as well as ensuring methods for reporting are maintained
Proactively make recommendations to the Associate Manager of Planning to help drive initiatives for financial planning and business intelligence systems
Translate all Studio strategic and growth initiatives into operational metrics and dashboards to monitor project performance results
Carry out ad-hoc reporting and data analysis requests, articulate metrics and establish analytical models for various forecasting needs
Strategy & Growth Support (40%)
Lead analyses and develop the business cases for studio initiatives relating to new ways of working, including new or improved technology solution and corporate initiatives that are supported by studio operations
Suggest thoughtful methodologies to analyze business requirements within a project
Build models to back up financial decisions and reduce business risk
Proactively anticipate, identify and remove roadblocks, and work cross-functionally to ensure everything stays on track
Liaise and collaborate with various SMES and business stakeholders of the Studio, including Finance, Technology, Product, and Real Estate, to socialize strategy, to gather project requirements, and to understand user needs
Document needs and business requirements from internal and external stakeholders for assigned projects
Business Processes & Integration (20%)
Streamline and optimize internal processes and interaction flow with various stakeholders of the Studio, including Finance, Technology, Product, and Real Estate, to contribute to data alignment and to ensure integration of growth initiatives
Performing ongoing reviews of business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Maintain and improve the Studio Planning Team knowledge base through standard, concise and relevant documentation

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field
3-5 years of experience in business analysis, data analysis or project management
Prior experience in data processing, manipulating large datasets, querying databases, data analysis, and reporting
Experience with data management and visualization software such as Tableau or similar data discovery and visualization tools, an asset
Knowledge of process mapping software (Lucidchart, Visio)
Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills, French an asset
Skills
Capacity to synthesize and simplify complex information
Detail oriented with a results-driven mindset
Highly analytical with the ability to present exec-level recommendations and influence through sound quantitative and qualitative analysis
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced performance-driven environment, juggling multiple projects/multi-task and work effectively under pressure
Strong interest in retail and e-commerce and a passion for shaping the future of e-commerce an asset
Knowledge of fashion, styling and photography, an asset
Solution-oriented mindset and can-do attitude to overcome challenges
Team player with a natural ability to build relationships and collaborate

Title: Senior Credit Analyst
Desc: PayBright, an Affirm company, provides affordable and transparent installment payment plans to Canadians at checkout. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing fintech companies, we partner with thousands of domestic and international retailers like Hudson’s Bay, Samsung, Sephora, Wayfair, and eBay to offer flexible payment plans to consumers – both in-store and online. In January 2021, PayBright was acquired by Affirm, one of the leading payment solutions providers in North America and a pioneer in our industry. In addition to being aligned on nurturing a diverse and supportive work culture, both PayBright and Affirm believe in the continual innovation of financial products that meet the needs of the modern consumer in the US, Canada, and beyond.We are a remote-first, diverse, and growing team of over 200 people, with a physical office located in downtown Toronto.Visit us at paybright.com to learn more!The Credit team works cross-functionally with Data Science, Product, Engineering and Capital Markets to responsibly manage the risk profile of the business. We’re looking for an intelligent, driven individual who wants to learn, grow, and solve hard problems.The team’s mandate is to enable sustainable growth while closely managing the profitability and resilience of our portfolio. As Affirm continues on an exciting growth trajectory; thinking through credit policies for new initiatives and products, developing effective risk management strategies and capabilities, shaping ongoing testing and experimentation, and being ready for navigating through any exogenous changes will be important problems to tackle.This role requires extensive use of data analytics to derive insights and develop credit strategies. It also requires a lot of cross-functional partnership. Working with the Data Science and Engineering team to develop new underwriting models and risk management capabilities, with the Product teams to develop new products and features, with the Merchant Pricing team to value different merchants, with the Finance team to help facilitate discussions with debt and equity investors are some parts of the role.Come join us in our mission to change consumer finance through better data and technology, lower costs, and increased transparency while providing the best customer experience.What you'll doPartner with Data Science and Engineering on building risk analytics capabilitiesDevelop robust life-time valuation infrastructure and capabilitiesUse advanced data analytics and critical thinking to derive insights and optimize credit strategiesOwn risk initiatives within new product formation and new market explorationMonitor portfolio as well as macroeconomic trends impacting loan performance. Drive adjustments to our underwriting and marketing strategies to mitigate riskWhat we look forPassion and drive to change banking, payments and online marketing for the better3-5 years work experience as a data analyst (consumer credit risk management strongly preferred)Curiosity to learn about data, models and algorithmsExtensive experience with SQL and PythonAbility to collaborate and influence across different teams in the organizationAbility to communicate findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiencesA passion for finding insights in data and driving change based on those insightsIntelligence + Humility. Hubris is the fastest way to blow up a business!Location - Remote Canada#LI-RemotePayBright is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles can be located anywhere within the province of Ontario. Employees in remote roles have the option of working remotely in Ontario or from PayBright’s Toronto office, and may occasionally travel to an Affirm office or elsewhere for required meetings or team-building events. Our office in Toronto will remain operational and accessible for anyone to use on a voluntary basis, subject to local COVID-19 guidelines.Why should you apply?We provide an outstanding work environment in a high-growth industryWe focus on creating a positive and cohesive team-based environment, and aim to have fun doing our jobs!We have fun with regular team events and social activities (currently being held virtually due to COVID-19)We offer attractive compensation and benefits, including equity participationWe have a prime location in downtown Toronto near amenities and public transportationEqual Employment OpportunityOur diverse and inclusive team is part of what makes PayBright a fulfilling place to work. PayBright is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from persons of all backgrounds.We are proud to be partnered with the Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion.If you require any accommodations during the hiring process, please do not hesitate to let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.Job Type: Full-time

Title: Analyst, Client Insights & Analytics (Contract)
Desc:
Requisition ID: 148087
Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Analyst, Client Insights & Analytics (Contract)
Why work for Scotiabank?
Scotiabank is among the largest banks in the world and the most international bank in Canada. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. Together with our Digital Factories around the world, we are dedicated to helping our 25 million customers become better-off.
This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy. Say hello to a career at Scotiabank!

Global Banking and Markets
Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.
Purpose
Contributes to the overall success of the Client Insights & Analytics group within Global Banking & Markets globally ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
The Client Insights & Analytics team exists to support data driven decision making within the Global Banking and Markets division.
The mandate of the team is to:
Increase Scotiabank’s relevance with corporate and institutional clients
Develop client strategies with the business lines and drive its execution through data analytics
Support the monitoring of financial performance against plans, initiatives and objectives
Leverage internal and external client data to facilitate opportunity identification
Define and deliver CRM software enhancements that drive business value
Liaise with technology to enhance data quality and integrity
Accountabilities
Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge
Define and maintain the data integrity and data architecture
Perform data analysis to identify data integrity issues/trends and report findings
Configure and execute data cleansing activities
Develop and implement data correction plans to address issues as they arise
Ensure that automated data imports/exports contain appropriate data and run in a timely manner
Consolidate information from a variety of internal and external sources to create value added client insights through business intelligence tools (ex. Tableau, PowerBI, and etc.)
Develop insightful and sustainable Business Intelligence reporting, and responsible for data quality
Daily maintenance and monitoring of online BI reporting status and key client MIS data for GBM
Collaborate with technology partners to build sustainable data integrity processes
Support ad hoc analysis requests as required
Investigate discrepancies and reconcile source data
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Champions a high-performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
Requirements
Undergraduate degree in finance/economics/math/computer science.
3+ years of experience in client analytics, data analytics, business analysis, financial reporting or similar role
Minimum 1 year of experience in data analysis/data management preferably with a CRM system
Strong communication skills and ability to clearly explain complex topics in a simple way
Strong experience in large-scale data remediation projects is a major plus
Excellent knowledge of IT/Data best practices and database concepts
Strong experience with process implementation and improvement
Strong experience in data reconciliation, management, aggregation and analysis techniques
Knowledge of SDLC methodologies such as Agile is a plus
Strong understanding of 3rd party data (such as Bloomberg, Capital IQ) and API integration
Experience with Tableau, Power BI, Salesforce or Python is preferred
Detail oriented and customer focused
Ability to be a self-starter who excels working independently with minimal supervision
Experience in a work environment with frequently shifting priorities
Working Conditions
Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours are a common occurrence. Limited/moderate/extensive (update as appropriate) travel domestically/internationally/globally (update as appropriate).
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.
At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: CRM Analyst
Desc:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Business Banking Divisional Office is an energized team responsible for delivering strategic leadership and capabilities for the Better Business Bank of today and tomorrow. The Customer and Colleague Engagement Strategy (CCES) team supports Better Business Bankers in the pursuit of TD's Quest and supports a caring performance culture while having fun doing so! The Sales team supports sales strategy, customer experience, sales effectiveness, and partner management. Our Engagement team is responsible for Colleague and Customer Engagement for all Business Banking channels.

The CRM Analyst will report into the Senior Manager, BBCRM and work closely with various stakeholders to support the CRM platform
Job Description
Are you familiar with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms? Are you excited about the thought of being part of a new CRM delivery to TD Business Banking from the ground level? Are you a results-oriented individual that uses data and analytics to support their decision-making to drive change? If yes, this role may be for you! It will give you an opportunity to be a member of the team that will roll out a new CRM platform to TD's Business Bank and help ensure that it is a tool that will help our Bankers succeed!

The CRM Analyst will be responsible for supporting the Business Banking CRM team as they develop and refine the strategy and vision of the new CRM platform which will enhance the way our Business Bankers work as they strive to achieve TD's Quest. This role involves performing platform/user adoption reporting & analysis, supporting day-to-day inquires of new and existing applications, maintaining and updating training materials, supporting training sessions, and much more!
Job Requirements
To be successful in this role, you will require:
The main deliverable of the BBCRM team and overarching goal is to extract the most value from the CRM platform and enable our Business Bankers to perform their best. Success in this role would be difficult without passion for this purpose.
The CRM Analyst must treat all their initiatives as though they are their own. Being a self-starter is key to success, as is being resourceful, a strong problem-solver, and able to navigate ambiguous situations.
The CRM Analyst will be part of building & developing many reports and analysis, so previous analytical experience and building out reporting rhythms is important. In addition, the results and insights must be communicated in simple easy to digest ways so they can be shared across teams where needed.
The CRM Analyst will need to maintain and update several types of resources as they are developed or modified, such as job aids, training documents, and processes etc.
The CRM Analyst requires solid organizational skills to stay on top of deliverables.
This job involves connecting and working with many groups, therefore, this role requires strong relationship management skills, as we work towards a single user experience. The CRM Analyst will need to be able to work independently, but also be a team-player who can collaborate with the broader CCES team.
The CRM Analyst should have a solid understanding of Business Banking's organizational structure, as well as its processes and procedures.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, having proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint are very important. Working knowledge of Salesforce, JIRA & Confluence and would also be an asset.
Prior experience in a customer-facing role in Commercial, Small Business, would be considered an asset, with a high value placed on previous exposure to existing CRM.
Five (5) or more years relevant experience
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
