 Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
 Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
 Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Business Analyst
Desc:
Join GroupHEALTH Benefit Solutions® today and become part of an organization that is transforming the way Canadian’s experience benefits.
Our mission is simple; We develop and deliver the most cost-effective employee benefits solutions to Canadian businesses.
GroupHEALTH is accelerating - and you provide the fuel.
We're currently looking for a Business Analyst to join our team in Surrey, BC on a hybrid basis. You'll collaborate with business stakeholders and the technology team to understand business objectives and assess needs, document workflows and user stories, and performs root cause analysis to ensure requirements will drive optimal experiences for platform users and customers. You will propose and manage solutions, capture detailed technical specifications, and drive the requirements gathering process from start to finish.
Essential responsibilities include managing relationships, communications, business process development and analysis, data analysis, requirements elicitation and definition, solution configuration, documentation, quality assurance support, and training.
Outcomes
Within 3 months:
Become familiar with the GroupHEALTH Family of Companies (GHFOC) and the organizational structure within IT
Conduct walkthroughs with various functions to understand key business processes
Become familiar with core business applications, data flows and reports
Become familiar with IT and project management governance processes
Requirements gathering completed for 2-4 projects
Oversee multiple support tickets
Within 6 months:
Progressively begin building your own personal brand within the company by showcasing what you do well
Drive requirements gathering for several strategic priorities including seeing it through to release
Solid understanding of the group benefits industry and our value proposition
Knowledge of all internal systems and what department benefits from them
Help with project management and quality assurance as needed
Within 1 year:
Clear understanding of administrative systems and integrations used across GHFOC
Deep understanding of GHFOC wide process flows
Assist team in developing and maintaining PMO standards and procedures
Ongoing requirements gathering for projects of strategic importance
Responsibilities
Interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Develop business and systems requirements for projects using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and develop functional requirements
Support design and execution of test scripts and test scenarios
Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs
Continuously learn business processes, applications, and technical specifications to build skills necessary to carry out the Business Analyst role more effectively
Support all phases of PMO processes improvement initiatives and develop best practices and tools for business analysis
Education & Experience
University degree or college diploma in the field of Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or comparable areas
3+ years direct work experience in a business analyst capacity
Excellent spoken and written communication skills
Familiarity with processes such as UML, use cases, test plans
Proficient with various software programs, such as MS Word, MS Excel, MS Visio, Atlassian Jira Software
Knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of business analysis, and project management techniques and tools
Strong analytical, mathematical, and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage and complete multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
In addition to becoming part of a creative, challenging, and stimulating work environment, we also offer:
a competitive salary & benefits program
paid time off, including flex time
education assistance
Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) with employer matching
Participation in our Happy Friday Program
Want to be part of a rapidly growing company that is transforming the way Canadian’s experience benefits? Apply now!
We thank everyone who applies to the role; however, due to the volume of applications we receive, we are only able to contact candidates who have been selected for an interview.

Title: Senior Inventory Analyst
Desc:
JOB DESCRIPTION
POSITION OBJECTIVE:
The Inventory team at Acklands Grainger manages over 500K Stock Keeping Units and $170 million across multiple distribution centres, branches, and on-sites across Canada. Our primary responsibility is to have the right product in the right place for customers, strategically balancing capital and OPEX investment of inventory dollars, labour and holding space.
The Senior Inventory Analyst will be responsible for providing functional expertise and guidance regarding daily execution and continuous improvement of inventory planning processes and policies.
KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The Senior Inventory Analyst will be accountable for functional expertise over select planning areas within the network for specific business policies and procedures, as assigned, within (but not limited to) the following areas:
Demand Capture
Demand Management
Forecasting
EOQ / Safety Stock
DRP / Deployment
Stocking Policy
Market Intelligence
Based on the specific assigned area of ownership, the Senior Inventory Analyst will:
Partner with leadership in developing supply chain strategies to meet customer service and meet inventory performance targets for the network.
Facilitate discussions with regional or national business representatives to adapt the planning system to effectively accommodate business unit needs.
Identify and recommend enhancements to supply chain systems.
Work with cross functional and cross border Supply Chain partners to gain alignment on business policies and system functionality to execute those policies.
Forecast and manage the flow of product to the Distribution Centers and/or Branches and/or on-sites.
Build and maintain relationships with Acklands Grainger and Grainger US Supply Chain partners to develop building-specific strategies, identify constraints, and recommend and execute solutions to meet performance metric goals and support long-term supply chain objectives. Perform system maintenance and maintain master data within planning areas and processes as needed.
Review and analyze planning data to prepare reports for management review.
Perform ad-hoc analyses as needed.Provide thought leadership and business guidance to department analysts to make the team better as an informal leader.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Completion of post-secondary degree, preferably in Business or equivalent business experience with a minimum of 3 to 5 years’ experience in Supply Chain
Strong analytic fundamentals, proficiency in analyzing large data sets to solve problems and experience working with cross-functional partners
Understanding of key financial, customer service and supply chain metrics
Ability to influence without authority
Use of data and analytics to tell a story to relevant business leaders
Proficiency in Microsoft Office; requires knowledge of downloading and uploading information via mainframe and PC systems
Project Management and continuous improvement experience a plus
Proficiency in Business Objects and/or Teradata and/or SQL and/or PowerBI a plus
Working knowledge of SAP Supply Chain Suite, particularly Advance Planning & Optimization or Service Parts Planning a plus
JOB REQUIREMENTS
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Completion of post-secondary degree, preferably in Business or equivalent business experience with a minimum of 3 to 5 years’ experience in Supply Chain
Strong analytic fundamentals, proficiency in analyzing large data sets to solve problems and experience working with cross-functional partners
Understanding of key financial, customer service and supply chain metrics
Ability to influence without authority
Use of data and analytics to tell a story to relevant business leaders
Proficiency in Microsoft Office; requires knowledge of downloading and uploading information via mainframe and PC systems
Project Management and continuous improvement experience a plus
Proficiency in Business Objects and/or Teradata and/or SQL and/or PowerBI a plus
Working knowledge of SAP Supply Chain Suite, particularly Advance Planning & Optimization or Service Parts Planning a plus

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst – GIS
Desc:
Job Description: 
   Senior Business Systems Analyst – GIS
 IT Solutions Division
 Contract Full-Time; 12 Months
 Pay Band: $84,335 - $105,417 per annum
 
Reporting to the Advisor, Enterprise GIS, the Senior Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for conducting the analysis activities required to understand the structure, policies and operations of Regional programs in order to recommend GIS/IT solutions that enable the program to achieve its goals. The analysis can be conducted at enterprise, program, service, process, project or functional levels.

 Responsibilities:

 You will elicit the needs in terms of functional, non-functional or information requirements of the technology solution and manage the requirements elicitation activities from the initial stages to delivery of the technology solution. 
You will also perform requirements management and communication tasks by managing requirements conflicts, issues and changes
 Prioritize and progressively elaborate stakeholder and solution requirements in order to enable the project team to implement a solution that will meet the needs of the sponsoring organization and stakeholders
 Assesses proposed solutions to determine which solution best fits the business need, identify gaps and shortcomings in solutions, and determine necessary workarounds or changes to the solution
 Documents the analysis outcome using formal techniques such as workflow diagramming, use case analysis, process mapping and conceptual information/data modeling amongst others, and develop/assist with the development of business cases to properly justify projects or efforts intended to bridge the gap between the business needs and an implemented solution
 Translates the functional or user requirements into system concepts and system specifications including the determination of non-functional requirements and technical constraints. 
Carries out direct or indirect activities such as writing of technical specifications for RFPs, solution architecture and design, build, system test or technical acceptance from vendor, technical documentation and solution deployment
 Assists with usability and solution acceptance testing to ensure agreed upon requirements are properly supported by the delivered solution, and conduct TRA.

 Qualifications:

 A university degree in Computer Science, GIS, or a related field with a minimum of five (5) years of experience as a GIS Business or Systems Analyst; or an equivalent combination of education and experience
 Experience with ESRI or Intergraph
 Certified Business Analysis Professional – CBAP certification from International Institute of Business Analysis required or obtained within one year of employment
 Expertise in BPMN and UML modeling notations
 Aware of model driven architecture (MDA), and service oriented architecture (SOA)
 Extensive experience conducting Joint Application/Analysis Design (JAD) sessions
 Expertise in all aspects of the Systems Delivery Life Cycle
 Practical knowledge of agile methods and traditional (waterfall) methods
 Software development expertise
 Aware of best practices in information technology service and solution delivery such as PMBOK, COBIT, ITIL, etc.
 Experience with Oracle or SQL Server
 Experience with two or more software development and design tools listed: Oracle, SQL Server, PowerBuilder, Visual Studio (C++, VB, C#, ASP.NET), Java, HTML, Python, XML (XML Publisher, XML Spy), Enterprise Architect, Toad, Erwin, DB Scripting (PL_SQL, Transact SQL), RoboHelp, Visio, Crystal Reports, Document X and Help Studio and other similar application development tools
 Web Modeling experience, Enterprise Service Bus experience and/or Customer Relationship Management systems is considered as an asset
 Ability to travel to various regional locations


 If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.


 Location: In this role you will have the ability to work remotely and attend on-site when required based on operational requirements at 10 Peel Centre Drive, Brampton. The frequency of on-site activities may vary on a weekly basis and based on operational requirements. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario.


 Hours of Work
: 35 hours per week
  

 Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.


 If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.



 As part of the Region’s ongoing commitment to health and safety, there are enhanced Covid-19 specific safety protocols and/or personal protective equipment requirements (e.g. masks, eye protection, etc.) in place to help protect health and safety. The additional requirements are determined based on the nature of the work being carried out.




 New employees who commence employment on or after October 1, 2021 are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Being fully vaccinated is determined as the status of having received the full series of approved vaccines (both doses of a two dose vaccine series, one dose of a single dose vaccine series) and any additional doses required and approved by Health Canada and having satisfied the full post vaccination period required to ensure vaccination efficacy. The Region of Peel reserves the right to request proof of vaccination at any time. Acceptable proof includes an Ontario Ministry of Health COVID-19 vaccine receipt which you can obtain through the Provincial portal 
https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/
, or other government-issued vaccine passport or certification.



 The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario 
Human Rights Code. If you are not fully vaccinated
, a documented medical reason provided by a physician or registered nurse and time period for the medical reason may be accepted.

 About Us: 
   The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region. 
Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.
 To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca.
 Additional Information: 
  
    The Region of Peel is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.
  


 The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request. If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.ca. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.
  


 Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Title: Laboratory Analyst
Senior Analyst, Information Quality
Desc:
Category Data Analysis

City Toronto, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada


Job Description Senior Analyst, Information Quality


Who we are
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include
HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
Retirement Planning Program
Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
Work-life balance
Career Planning Program
Learning and Professional Development Program
Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts


Why is this role important?
The Senior Analyst, Information Quality is responsible for evaluating and reporting on the quality of CIHI’s data holdings and information products by compiling and interpreting data and information from multiple sources, including carrying out statistical and qualitative analyses. They will support the development, implementation and improvement of corporate information quality tools and processes, including metadata and activities related to SAS data governance.


Working closely with CIHI staff and external stakeholders, the Senior Analyst will be responsible for helping identify client-specific and corporate data and information quality needs; planning and conducting analyses; synthesizing, summarizing and presenting results; and critically reviewing other sources of information such as research literature and technical documents. They will also participate in knowledge exchange, process improvement initiatives, strategic planning and promoting a quality culture across CIHI.


What you'll do
1. Develops and maintains a detailed knowledge of CIHI data sources including: reporting standards, data processes and methods, information quality, related analytical/information products.


2. Develops and maintains a detailed knowledge of CIHI’s Information Quality Framework and the tools and activities that it encompasses; and supports its enhancement and implementation across the organization in accordance with the CIHI’s Information Quality Plan.

3. Participates in quality-related projects, including project development, planning and coordination; conducting analysis; summarizing and interpreting results; writing reports and presenting findings to internal and external clients.

4. Provides consultative support to internal and external clients with respect to the analysis of data to help identify, investigate and document quality issues; and suggest ways to improve information quality.


5. Participates in the development and delivery of internal education and knowledge exchange sessions relating to data and information quality.

6. Assists in the development of analytical techniques and information quality monitoring tools as needed. Develops and documents new analytic methodologies in collaboration with CIHI staff.


7. Keeps current with respect to the relevant research literature.

8. Participates in other corporate project teams as required.

9. Contributes to the promotion of CIHI products and services through participation on committees, attendance at conferences, assisting with the preparation of articles for publication and other activities as required.

10. Respects privacy and confidentiality of information by following policies in Privacy and Confidentiality of Health Information at CIHI and related procedures and directives.

11. Assumes responsibility for other related duties as assigned


What you'll bring to the table
Undergraduate degree in a relevant subject (e.g. Health Information, Statistics, Social Sciences)


3 - 5 years related experience. Preference will be given to candidates with experience in:
Synthesizing and presenting information for different audiences
Information quality management practices
Analyzing multiple large and complex datasets (including longitudinal data)

Strong conceptual and problem solving skills.

Strong verbal communication skills; strong analytical and technical writing skills.

Ability to synthesize and translate data into information for non-analysts, including strong data visualization and report writing skills.

Knowledge of SAS for data analysis and statistical methods (advanced SAS knowledge is an asset).

Knowledge of data and information quality concepts, tools, methodologies and practices and the ability to apply them to a variety of data and products.

Knowledge of data governance practices, including metadata management, is an asset.

Ability to multi-task and work effectively in a matrix environment.

Knowledge of CIHI’s databases. Advanced knowledge of one or more is an asset.

Knowledge of the Canadian health care system is an asset.

Ability to fulfill occasional travel requirements.

Fluency in both official languages is an asset.


Closing Statement
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


Employment Equity
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.




Analyste principal, Qualité des données


Notre organisation
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants :
une structure salariale concurrentielle
un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
un programme de planification de la retraite
un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
un programme de planification de carrière
des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel


Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
L’analyste principal, Qualité de l’information, évalue la qualité des banques de données et des produits d’information de l’ICIS et en fait rapport en compilant et en interprétant les données et l’information provenant de sources multiples, ce qui comprend l’exécution d’analyses statistiques et qualitatives. Il appuie l’élaboration, la mise en œuvre et l’amélioration des outils et des processus de l’ICIS liés à la qualité de l’information, notamment les métadonnées.

En étroite collaboration avec le personnel de l’ICIS et les intervenants externes, l’analyste principal aide à cerner les besoins des clients et de l’organisme en matière de qualité des données et de l’information, planifie et réalise des analyses, synthétise, résume et présente les résultats et scrute avec un œil critique d’autres sources d’information, comme des travaux de recherche et des documents techniques. Il participe également aux activités d’échange de connaissances, aux initiatives d’amélioration des processus, à la planification stratégique et à la promotion d’une culture organisationnelle de la qualité.


Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
1. Acquérir et maintenir une connaissance approfondie des banques de données de l’ICIS, y compris les normes de déclaration, les méthodes et processus liés aux données, la qualité de l’information ainsi que les produits analytiques et d’information connexes.

2. Acquérir et maintenir une connaissance approfondie du Cadre de la qualité de l’information de l’ICIS de même que des outils et activités qui s’y rattachent, et en appuyer l’amélioration et la mise en œuvre à l’échelle de l’organisme conformément au Plan d’assurance de la qualité de l’information de l’ICIS.

3. Participer aux projets sur la qualité, dont l’élaboration, la planification et la coordination de projets, la réalisation d’analyses, la synthèse et l’interprétation des résultats, la rédaction de rapports et la présentation de résultats aux clients internes et externes.

4. Offrir un soutien consultatif aux clients internes et externes en ce qui a trait à l’analyse des données en vue de repérer, d’étudier et de consigner les problèmes de qualité des données et suggérer des façons d’améliorer la qualité de l’information.

5. Participer à l’élaboration et à la présentation de séances internes de formation et de partage des connaissances sur la qualité des données et de l’information.

6. Contribuer à l’élaboration de techniques analytiques et d’outils de contrôle de la qualité de l’information, au besoin. Élaborer et consigner les nouvelles méthodologies analytiques en collaboration avec le personnel de l’ICIS.

7. Rester au fait des travaux de recherche pertinents.

8. Collaborer avec d’autres équipes de projets de l’ICIS, au besoin.

9. Contribuer à la promotion des produits et services de l’ICIS en participant à des comités, à des conférences, à la préparation d’articles pour publication et à d’autres activités, au besoin.

10. Respecter le droit à la vie privée et protéger la confidentialité des renseignements en suivant les politiques énoncées dans le document Le respect de la vie privée et la confidentialité des renseignements personnels sur la santé à l’ICIS ainsi que les procédures et directives connexes.

11. Assumer d’autres fonctions connexes assignées.


Que mettriez-vous à profit ?

Diplôme de premier cycle dans une discipline pertinente (p. ex. information sur la santé, statistique ou sciences sociales).

3 à 5 ans d’expérience pertinente. La préférence sera accordée aux candidats ayant de l’expérience dans les domaines suivants :
la synthétisation et la présentation d’information destinée à divers publics;
les pratiques de gestion de la qualité de l’information;
l’analyse de nombreux ensembles de données volumineux et complexes (incluant les données longitudinales).

Excellentes aptitudes pour la conceptualisation et la résolution de problèmes.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication orale ainsi que pour l’analyse et la rédaction technique.

Aptitudes à résumer et à vulgariser les données pour les non-analystes, notamment d’excellentes aptitudes pour la présentation visuelle des données et pour la rédaction de rapports.

Expérience de l’utilisation de SAS et connaissance des méthodes d’analyse de données et statistiques (connaissance approfondie de SAS, un atout).

Connaissance des concepts, des outils, des méthodologies et des pratiques liés à la qualité des données et de l’information et capacité de les utiliser pour diverses données et produits.

Connaissance des pratiques de gouvernance des données, y compris la gestion des métadonnées, un atout.

Capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches de front et de travailler efficacement dans un environnement matriciel.

Connaissance des bases de données de l’ICIS; connaissance approfondie d’au moins une, un atout.

Connaissance du système de santé canadien, un atout.

Capacité de répondre aux exigences de déplacements occasionnels.

Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français, un atout


Declaration
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.


Équité en emploi
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.

Title: LRM Application Analyst
Desc:
West Fraser is a leading diversified forest products company. We are listed on the TSX and recognized for the eighth time, as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers and one of Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates. Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? We are a growing Company looking for talented people to be part of our team. Our Information Technology group in Quesnel, BC has an opportunity for an:
 LRM Application Support Analyst
 As part of the IT group, this role will provide support, analysis, and development assistance for the Land Resource Manager (LRM) enterprise application which supports the woodland operations areas of the business. It will be your responsibility to define, develop, test, analyze and maintain reports, integrations and applications to support strategic initiatives and enhance business performance. This includes writing, coding, testing, and analyzing data. You will also research, design, document, and modify specifications. You should have the ability to work in a dynamic environment and a willingness to troubleshoot technical issues.
 You will be responsible for:

 Being a lead resource in projects implementing new technologies to support strategic initiatives
 Supporting Trimble LRM (Land Resource Manager) – An enterprise application for managing woodlands resources
 Leading in maintenance, support, and operational troubleshooting of systems and applications to continuously improve service availability
 Coordinating with key stakeholders for testing, enhancement, and upgrades of business systems
 Identifying opportunities for improvement with our timber management technologies and implementing them
 Integrating into a team of professionals motivated to use technology to give our organization a competitive advantage
 Defining technical solutions to business challenges
 Providing technical support for databases related to LRM including”
 User and Security management Databases Tuning Data loading

 As the ideal candidate you bring:

 Four-year university or technical institute degree in the field of Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent work experience
 Enterprise application support and configuration experience
 A drive and ability to learn new technologies in short timeframes
 Systems integration, interface design, data conversion and solution architecture experience
 Moderate knowledge of PL/SQL or T-SQL Languages
 Basic knowledge of Oracle and Microsoft data migration and ETL tools
 JavaScript experience is an advantage
 Knowledge of ITIL processes
 Well-established organizational skills
 Excellent communication skills
 Detailed and proactive approach to work
 Experience with Trimble LRM (Land Resource Manager)

 West Fraser Timber has over 60 locations across Canada, the United States and Europe. We believe strongly in promoting from within and pride ourselves on providing a challenging environment with continuous development. The successful candidate should be interested in future growth opportunities within the company. West Fraser offers an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits and an outstanding pension plan.
 If this position sounds like the career for you, submit your cover letter and resume at www.westfraser.com/jobs click "apply now" in green at the top of the page.
 For more information on West Fraser and our current opportunities, visit our website at: www.westfraser.com/jobs
 We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Central Planning Analyst
Desc:
Company Introduction:
T&T Supermarket Inc. was found in 1993 with two stores in BC. Since then, it has expanded rapidly and is now Canada’s largest Asian supermarket chain with 29 stores across the country: 13 in BC, 6 in Alberta, and 10 in Ontario. The Company’s continuous expansion is bringing forward its first-ever store in Montreal, Quebec and 3 more new stores in BC, Alberta, and Ontario, all set to open in 2022/2023.
The Role:
Reporting to the Manager, Central Planning the Central Planning Analyst provides assistance and support to the team by analyzing data and generating reports using database management skills, coordinating with different parties internally and following up on various projects as required.
Major Responsibilities:
Review to analyze monthly sales/inventory history
Purchasing to replenish stock in timely manner
Manage vendors and work with shipping teams to ensure products arrival on time
Meet replenishment KPIs and maintain purchasing records, prepares summary statistical analysis
Monitor forecasting errors and improve forecast accuracies
Provide feedback on capacity risks and supply issues to merchants and planning partners where necessary
Knowledge, Skills and Ability Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree in Statistic, Mathematic, or other relate disciplines
Minimum 1-years’ experience in purchasing / demand forecasting
Ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders, taking initiative and managing multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment
Analytical thinking and has ability to identify alternatives to solve problems
Ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization and with external stakeholders
Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook etc.
Food industry experience is an asset
Data analysis with power BI is an asset
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to communicate in Chinese (Cantonese and/or Mandarin) is an asset
Benefit
Quarterly discretionary bonus
Life/AD&D insurance
Extended health/dental/vision care
Retirement benefit
Paid annual/sick/marriage/bereavement leave
Subsidized staff meal
In-store staff purchase discount
Work Hours
 5-day work week (Monday to Friday), 9:00am – 5:30pm
Safety Statement

Safety continues to be T&T Supermarket’s top priority. We’ve established health and safety policies and measures to ensure our working environment is as safe as possible.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Cloud - 336363
Desc:
Senior Business Systems Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst.
Senior Business Systems Analyst – Job Description
Provide support and produce detailed system requirements and technical/functional specifications in alignment with standards and frameworks
Work in close partnership with business partners/technology/project teams and stakeholders to elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications
Develop effective and efficient solutions by researching/analyzing current state system capabilities and defining technology solutions options/recommendations working closely with key technology partners (e.g., Solution Architects and Quality Assurance staff)
Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications and non-functional specifications
Support testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing
Support and contribute to project management activities by participating in the scoping and estimating of project efforts, risks identification and mitigation measures recommendation, communicating activity status and providing timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems to the Project Manager
Participate in quality management reviews, in particular reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements
Support collaboration with key stakeholders to determine solutions, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and how to manage the integration
May provide operational/process related analysis and support to various extents
Ensure best practices related to the BSA discipline are adhered to and enforced within project processes and deliverables
Adhere to existing processes/standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, well-defined enterprise technology delivery practices and standards, and business technology architecture, escalating escalate issues as required
Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in bank services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery
Continuously enhance knowledge of business domains and their products/services
Support the development of business cases including benefits identification, RFI/RFP and service level agreements with vendors/suppliers consistent with technology requirements/guidelines
Maintain ongoing communication with all stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle
Able to perform BSA tasks effectively while assigned to a single project or multiple concurrent projects
Prioritize and manage own workload in order to deliver quality results and meet timelines
Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units
Coach new or less experienced colleagues and act as a reference for the requirements management lifecycle
Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency of the business unit and/or team

Senior Business Systems Analyst – Mandatory Skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and comfortable working with both Business and Technical teams
Self-starter with the ability to multi-task effectively and independently within a fast-paced environment
Able to gauge the appropriate level of priority and detail and/or effort on any given project
Able to adapt quickly to changing priorities
Highly motivated with a proven track record of delivering results
Exhibit effective problem-solving skills with a high degree of attention to detail
Excellent time management and prioritization skills
Demonstrated ability to follow-up on issues independently and ensure they are resolved promptly, escalating when necessary
Expert knowledge of system analysis process and techniques
Expert knowledge of systems and applications supported by the team including system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows, and business rules
Expert knowledge of enterprise technology delivery practices and standards and related expertise including design, development, testing and project management
Advanced to Expert understanding of business supported and broader organization
Works independently as the senior or lead system analyst and coaches/ guides members within area of expertise
Subject matter expert and consults with clients and/or project teams and may be involved in the assessment of potential projects
Reports to Senior Manager or above
Undergraduate degree
10+ years relevant experience

Senior Business Systems Analyst – Nice to Have Skills
Graduate degree, preferred

Senior Business Systems Analyst - Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 6 months to start
Senior Business Systems Analyst - Assignment Location
Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

Title: Business Analyst, System Optimization
Desc:
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
Effective October 26, 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.
We are proud of the innovation, dedication, partnership and tenacity of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
We are currently hiring for a Business Analyst, System Optimization located in Surrey, BC.
Build on your education and career experience as you:
Collaborates with business units and stakeholders for identifying reporting needs, analyzing current procedures, identifying opportunities, reducing redundancies and ensuring reporting processes support business objectives.
Works on and/or leads projects to improve dynamic reporting through report automation, and the adoption of emerging analytical methodologies, and BI tools and technologies.
Develops interactive business intelligence reports and participates in the design, development and testing of performance reporting solutions using PowerBI.
Conducts performance reporting benchmarking/best practices research and makes recommendations for improvement.
Develops and seeks continuous improvement of performance reporting processes including developing performance reporting tools used to automate and coordinate report inputs, analyses and distribution.
Ensures data is effectively gathered, mined and leveraged to support effective decision making in support of corporate strategies and provide quality assurance and a value-added review of reporting inputs to promote high standards for quality and insight.
Prepares strategic business cases and supporting documents, briefing papers, strategic and tactical reports for an assigned area and/or portfolio for submission to Fraser Health Executive, Board of Directors and other stakeholders.
Works collaboratively with members of the System Optimization department, senior management, staff of various organizational units and other internal and external stakeholders in support of the mission, philosophies and goals of Fraser Health.
Are you motivated to join us? We will be looking for you to have the following:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field, plus five (5) to seven (7) years of related experience in decision support, business analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Experience with T-SQL and PowerBI is preferred.
If this sounds like the ideal role for you, here are more reasons why you should apply:
A career that offers you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with health care providers who are excellent in their respective fields.
Fantastic opportunities for support and management roles are available as you advance within the organization.
Competitive salary package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
An opportunity to make a difference every single day in the world of health care.
Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Apply today so we can continue the conversation and make a difference in the communities we serve. We value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.
Curious to know what it’s like to work here? Like us on Facebook (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram (@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Desc:
Company Description  Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place.  Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together.   There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same.


  Job Description
   You will reimagine how we measure performance, effectiveness and the impact of our risk management controls to bring cohesion, standardization and better explain causality across the entire Seller lifecycle and ecosystem of products. You will have influence and drive change using convincing data-driven strategies to gain understanding and support from key stakeholders and leadership across the risk organization.
 As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst on the team, you will help define and drive risk strategy through data analysis and insights. You will manage top level Risk metrics, maintain and develop the data pipeline and ETL, establish core operational metrics, and drive process improvements through analysis. You will also build and coordinate executive presentation materials for Square's leadership team.

 You will:

 Diagnose problems and develop compelling, data-driven recommendations
 Partner with Product, Engineering, and Data Science teams to design solutions to operations problems, influence product roadmaps, and solution new products/processes
 Manage the development, reporting, and visualization of metrics for the entire Risk organization
 Develop and maintain various data pipelines and ETLs
 Improve risk solutions through third-party evaluation and integration with a focus on improving the seller experience
 Design and develop executive presentations for Square's leadership and board members




  Qualifications
  

 A BS/BA in Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Management Science, Computer Science, or a related technical field, OR BS/BA in Criminal Justice, Economics, Business, or a related business field
 8 or more years of relevant experience (or masters and 5+ years)
 Proficient in SQL
 Intermediate knowledge on Python (Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib etc.)
 Experience designing and creating data visualizations (e.g. Looker)
 The ability to answer unstructured questions and bring projects to conclusion
 A passion for Square's mission
 [Bonus] Experience in risk, trust & safety, payments, or spam prevention
 [Bonus] Experience with scripting and data analysis programming languages (e.g. Python, R, etc)
 [Bonus] Experience using statistics and machine learning
 [Bonus] Consulting / project management experience

 Additional Information
  
 We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
 We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.
 Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.
 Perks
 We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:

 Healthcare coverage
 Retirement Plans
 Employee Stock Purchase Program
 Wellness perks
 Paid parental leave
 Paid time off
 Learning and Development resources

 Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Desc:
Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.

Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.

How do we make work life better?

By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences
By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism
By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users

We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!

Location: For this role we are open to remote work located anywhere within the United States or Canada.

About the Opportunity:
Ceridian Data eXchange (CDX) is a comprehensive set of people, process and technology, used to direct and regulate the data integration between internal and external systems.
Dayforce Link is a centralized, secure cloud solution for internal and edge-based file transfers, including data transformation. Dayforce Link collects, transforms and delivers customer data both to and from internal Ceridian systems, as well as external trading partners.

What you’ll get to do:
Application Administration, Configuration, & Maintenance

Design, planning and implementation/engineering of integration solutions using IBM MFT Suite (Sterling File Gateway, Sterling Integrator, Sterling Secure Proxy/SEAS, IBM Control Center, IBM Perimeter Servers, etc)
Perform ifix’s and application upgrades
System testing, tuning and capacity planning
Monitor active Business Processes and assigned schedules
Experience with clustered architectures and associated High Availability, workload management and Disaster Recovery practices.
Configure and manage Routing Channel Templates
Design and support of Business Processes using the IBM Graphical Process Modeling tool
Command Line Adapter configuration, including working with Antivirus, GPG and network file sharing
MFT Trading Partner configuration setup using IBM Sterling Secure Proxy, using various communication protocols (SFTP, FTPS, HTTPS, FTP, SMB, Connect: Direct, etc)
Knowledge of Web services using methods such as soap and restful
Create custom file layers and custom email notifications
Perform technical configurations, such as network communications and adapter configuration
Onboard new employees by creating and supporting user accounts and user groups
Use audit records and trace logs to provide reporting as required

Security Standards

Ensure that the Command Line Adapter 2 is continually working with antivirus
Ensures all file transmissions and adapters are secured according to InfoSec standards
Manage GPG/PGP Keys to ensure they are functioning as required
Assist the Application Administrator with regular DR tests as required by BCP Team
Setup and manage services and adapters (i.e. SFTP/SMB/etc) including custom protocols as required
Proficient in various B2B communication protocols such as FTP, FTPS, SFTP, HTTP, HTTP/S, AS2, etc

Environments

Responsible for managing all environmental instances including Production, DR, Dev, and Test
Ensures each environment is built appropriately and functioning as required
Ensures data sets for each environment are sanitized as required
Deploy Resource Manager objects from environment to environment

Incident Support (Tier 3)

Act as an escalation point for Production Operators and Route Provisioners, by providing high-end technical support. This includes:

o. Product navigation (i.e. guidance around, and execution of complex tasks within the technology portfolio)
p. Data mining (i.e. investigating variances in data transactions totals)
q. Customer interaction (i.e. escalation point for customer concerns)

Track and update all incidents in the incident management system, ensuring that documentation is thorough, accurate and meets ticket quality standards and is resolved in a timely manner.
Review tickets for repetitive issues and collaborate with support teams to identify effective/sound solutions that will resolve these conclusively.

Change Management

Primary individual responsible for opening change requests
Ensures all environmental changes follow the proper change controls

Skills and Experience we value:

5+ Years practical experience as an application architect
Bachelors Degree in computer science or information systems preferred
Thorough knowledge in Unix/Linux platforms and writing shell scripts
Thorough knowledge of B2Bi and under laying technologies (BPML, XML, Xpath, SQL, network topologies and MFT)
Experience working with the following suite of IBM MFT technologies:

o. IBM Sterling File Gateway
p. IBM Sterling B2B Integrator
q. IBM Control Center
r. IBM Connect: Direct
s. IBM SEAS
t. IBM Secure Proxy CM
u. IBM Transformation Extender (ITX)

Required to understand and uphold all Ceridian Data eXchange, Infrastructure, Infosec, Privacy policies and standards

Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Title: Salesforce Business Analyst
Desc:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Perkins + Will, our Instagram, and our Blog.

We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.

Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.

Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.
We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!


What does the Salesforce Business Analyst look like?

At Bench we're aiming to make a profound difference in the lives of our customers, by making entrepreneurship more accessible. We are doing this by delivering disruptively affordable and simple accounting services for small businesses in the US - where 80% of business owners today either do not do any bookkeeping; or, struggle to do it themselves.

Reporting to our Team Lead of Business Operations Systems and Analytics, you'll be a critical team member helping implement an exciting, best-in-class, go-to-market system and process transformation. While you bring technical Salesforce knowledge and experience, you'll greatly expand your Salesforce experience and technical knowledge working with a highly skilled team to improve the user experience for the day-to-day sales and marketing activities and analytical decisions. With the Business Operations and analytics team members around you, you'll drive a transformation of how systems, data, and analytics support Bench's business from Salesforce. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you'll be leading process workshops, collaborating with Marketing and Sales Leaders to understand their process requirements, then working closely with technical teams to create outstanding solutions for Bench!

What you'll get up to:

Be responsible for configuration, design functionality, and end-user support of the Salesforce platform.
Analyze our current structure for all aspects of user and license management
Collaborate with various internal departments (Sales, Account Management, Retro) to ensure Salesforce environment continues to evolve for internal needs relating to functionality and performance
Establish and implement change control and best practices with regard to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.
Analyze the applications connected to Salesforce, including but not limited to Salesforce CPQ, Marketo, Salesloft, Distribution Engine, etc.
Identify production risks and areas for improvement; prioritize, design, and facilitate successful implementation and adoption of new processes.
Develop and implement training for end-users. Create and maintain all training materials and guides for processes related to Salesforce business applications.
Be accountable and results focused, including building strong relationships with others based on integrity and authenticity
Make mistakes and face challenges, but be motivated to learn fast from them and make high impact technical system improvements
Embrace feedback with arms wide open and action it to further your success
Be able to contribute to a high-performing team by bringing lots of mental horsepower, amazing work ethic, positive energy, and a little weirdness to keep things interesting

What you'll need:

3+ years of previous experience as a Salesforce Admin
Previous experience configuring and supporting the existing salesforce infrastructure including custom objects, record types, fields, page layouts, formulas, data validation rules, flows, etc.
2+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst, gathering business requirements from Sales or Marketing Teams, documenting processes, and building business cases for Salesforce implementations
Extensive experience with Process Improvement, identifying bottleneck, and creating process diagrams
Conduct system review sessions to optimize and streamline processes
Running workshops for requirements gathering
Demoing future state processes
Extensive experience breaking down the requirements backlog into logical subparts for Salesforce developers and administrators
For example: writing technical requirements for Salesforce Developers & Admin in Google Sheets or Jira
One of the following certifications: Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Advanced Admin, or Salesforce App Builder
An ability to collaborate with GTM Leaders and Senior Stakeholders to understand their process and workflow requirements and then develop an appropriate business case for specific managed packages within the Salesforce Ecosystem.
Experience analyzing or creating business cases for managed packages.
Be extremely interested and motivated to learn more about the Salesforce Platform
A genuine passion for helping people that create outstanding internal user experiences

It could be an even better fit if you have:

Experience with a combination of Agile and Waterfall (in the future we will be moving towards a more formal Agile Framework utilizing Scrum or Kanban).
An understanding of data structures, data flows, and data modeling.
Knowledge of object-oriented methodologies and approaches (so you can collaborate better with Salesforce Developers)

What you'll get:

At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $72,720 - $90,900 per year, depending on experience,
In addition,we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options and full health, dental, and vision.
You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
Our HQ is in downtown Vancouver BC, where we offer hybrid and remote working opportunities. This full-time position also has the flexibility to work remotely from anywhere else in BC, as well as Alberta, Ontario, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia.
Whether working remote or hybrid, we'll set you up with everything you need to work from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Desc:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Business Systems Analyst
Band 5
Role Summary:
The Business Systems Analyst will use his/her knowledge of business objectives, processes, products, technology and quality concepts to:
Partner with business and information technology areas to ensure the delivery of quality solutions that meet the needs of the business.
Plan and manage the business requirements effort required on small- to mid-sized projects to support business needs including change management of business requirements and estimating work effort.
Particpate as a member of project teams to implement business solutions and applications
Main Accountabilities:
Identify and assist in the re-engineering, improvement or replacement of existing business processes and associated technology
Elicit, document, examine and manage business requirements on projects by following the current company development methodology. This involves managing business requirements sessions, conducting interviews and accessing existing documentation
Understand relationships and facilitate the communication between the business and technology areas
Coordinate and facilitate business requirements gathering sessions, gap analysis, risk assessment and business requirements validation
Translate the business requirements into functional requirements. Ensure traceability and understanding of the requirements by all project/support members to enable systems enhancements /projects to be constructed
Participate in Project Management activities such as managing the delivery of projects through initiation, estimating, work planning, analysis, design, constructions, deployment and post-project review
Engage IT resources such as architects, designers, developers, and the testing team at the appropriate times in the project life cycle
Competencies:
Customer and results focused: ability to work with customers to understand and act based on their needs, assess risks, and achieve a valued result
Strong analysis, organization and problem solving skills
Consistently builds and maintains relationships within IT and with business clients
Adaptable: maintains effectiveness while managing competing demands, dealing with frequent change, delays or unexpected events
Dependable: Follows instructions in a timely manner, responds to management decisions and follows through on commitments
Professional: superior client facing skills, able to adjust approach to meet the needs of business sponsors and stakeholders. Treats others with respect, reacts well under pressure and accepts responsibility
Judgment: Uses sound and accurate judgment, supports and explains reasons for decisions and makes timely decisions
Proven leadership skills: ability to tactfully bring opinions, comments and thoughts forward. Able to drive discussions and manage business meetings to meet objectives
Strong communication skills: able to understand and accurately interpret the meaning, purpose and importance of verbal and non-verbal messages. Creates an open and trusting environment by sharing information in a timely manner. Ability to express ideas, thoughts and information so that it can be understood by others
Documentation: writes logically and concisely ensuring meaning is clear and presented in a way that meets the user's needs. Applies plain language principles, proper grammar and sentence structure
Innovative: looks for new, sometimes unconventional approaches to the way things are done
Teamwork: Enables and inspires others, assist members of the project team to meet common goals and timelines, works closely with and supports the Project Manager to delivery on time and on budget
Strong knowledge and experience using business analysis principles and industry best practices (eg. business process modeling, conceptual data modeling) and tools
Ability to work in a global multi-site environment
Experience working in a matrix environment, onshore/offshore IT model
Technical Skills:
Minimum 2 years experience as a business systems analyst involved in all phases of a project life cycle.
Analysis: able to break down high level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification
Deliverables: able to produce project documentation including but not limitied to: business, functional/non-functional, and user requirements documents, process and data maps, use cases, tracability matrix, report specifications, implementation and test plans, etc.
Knowledge of systems integration management methodologies, processes and techniques.
Facilitation: able to guide and keep a group on track, recognize issues that need to be dealt with, and ensure everyone is heard, guide the group through collaborative decision-making to achieve its goals
Consulting: Elicit information by applying approaches or styles applicable to the situation. Use questioning techniques and objective listening to clarify expectations and assumptions, make recommendations for alternatives to overcome challenges
Proficient with MS Office suite of products including MS Visio and MS Project
Experience with Third Party vendors and COTS implementation projects.
Assets:
Experience with CMMI or other process improvement methodology
CCBA or CBAP designation or working towards designation
The candidate selected for this role is required to have special clearance from the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)
#LI-Hybrid
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.
Sun Life is committed to the health and safety of all those in our workplaces and our communities. In accordance with Sun Life’s Vaccination Policy (Canada):
Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st. Employees in these roles may participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program as an alternative until April 30th.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
