Title: Senior Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
Desc:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
Position Title: Senior Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
Team and Location: Risk & Controls – Calgary, AB or Remote
Position Summary:
Reporting to the Manager, Risk and Controls (IT Audit), the Senior Analyst will assist with the IT compliance activities, across Parkland’s various businesses and operations, including IT, business transformation and integration initiatives.
The successful candidate will bring a commercially focused, value-add, risk management mindset and demonstrate a track record of ‘thinking outside of the box’ and driving significant innovation in the delivery of compliance audits.
Key Responsibilities:
Assist with developing and maintaining the IT Risk Assessment and scoping for Parkland; including identifying areas where compliance audits should focus.
Execute Parkland’s IT compliance (C-SOX and SOX) program including execution of walkthroughs and tests of design and operational effectiveness of IT controls. These include:
Assist with annual and ongoing IT compliance scoping to identify any changes to the systems, applications, and automated controls considered to be in-scope for the current fiscal year.
Prepare clear, concise, appropriately referenced work papers to document test procedures performed and conclusion drawn.
Pre and post- implementation reviews of system implementations or enhancements.
Coordinate compliance program testing IT controls with external audit IT team members, control owners, managers and executive Management.
Evaluate IT control deficiencies for impact and perform root cause analysis to determine appropriate Management actions.
Monitor Management’s remediation efforts to closure, including review of supporting evidence.
Support initiatives to improve controls, make processes more efficient, effective, and/or reduce cycle time for IT compliance.
Perform various other reviews of IT management policies and procedures such as change management, business continuity planning/ disaster recovery and information security to ensure that controls surrounding these processes are adequate.
Bring best practices and strong IT Controls methodology to help the department develop a “best in class” practice.
Assist with the implementation of data analytical tools to perform sampling, analyze data to improve audit and business efficiency and effectiveness, (including for risk assessments).
Support the maturation of IT Compliance program across the organization.
The team is to be regarded as a business partner when reviewing and developing procedures for the business. Policy and procedure research and development is required as well as review and recommending refinements.
Qualifications and Skills:
3 to 5 years of relevant C-SOX and SOX IT Controls experience.
Certified Information System Auditor (CISA) with Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) is considered an asset.
Excellent knowledge and experience of IT General Controls across domains such as access, change management, operations, application controls and reports testing.
Experience with application of data analytics and visualization (preferred).
Ability to build relationships with business customers.
Ability to manage confidential content.
Strong attention to detail and follow-up.
Ability to work under pressure, resolve problems and make decisions quickly and effectively, using a strong sense of self confidence.
Project management skills including the ability to work on various projects and prioritize accordingly.
Moderate knowledge of accounting practices (preferred).
High energy: Self-motivated with the ability to effectively manage concurrent projects.
We Offer:
Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.
Please note:
Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Project Operations Analyst / PMO Analyst / PSA Analyst
Desc:
Calligo is an award-winning managed data services provider. It has a global track record in improving organizations' productivity & profitability by making their data more available, secure and safe. The right candidate will be excited to work in a dynamic & collaborative value-centric technology company.

Within Calligo, the Project Management Office, is accountable to ensure the successful completion of projects against business objectives. The role ensures project execution happens with a focus on value generation, to ensure we are biasing towards action, have clear distribution of responsibilities on the project, are following the desired governance framework, providing necessary reporting and documentation to meet audit compliance standards, and providing reporting and communication to enable broader alignment and business integration.
Key Responsibilities

Help ensure Resource/Project management systems are kept up to date, with accurate information based on plans - both for pipeline projects (being setup by the Sales/Commercial team), and also ensuring that delivery teams / project leads are managing projects in accordance with defined expectations. These duties would include:
Ensuring pipeline projects plans are regularly reviewed and updates being made in alignment with commercial and pre-sales stakeholders
Ensuring timecards are being completed (submitted & approved) on time each week and at month end
Ensuring project status and other information needed is being regularly captured by the Project Leads
Ensuring the Executive and other Leads in the business are receiving the necessary reporting from the planning systems via the PowerBI reports, and updates to the systems and reporting are being delivered
Ensuring the system (workflows, fields etc) is continually being improved to maximize the value we receive from it, whilst reducing/removing unnecessary processes and data to create efficiency
Self-managing one’s time to maximize your personal contribution to the business, with a lens of profit-orientated PMO, including activities such as:
Continuous learning to increase one’s personal productivity, in terms of new tools and methods, or new business concepts or frameworks
Critically reflecting on one’s personal schedule, activities, and considering how to optimize and reduce waste via outdated or unnecessary meetings and activities
Critically reflecting on activities and initiatives, to understand how they will generate more customer value, and what the true customer need is
Collaborating with adjacent stakeholder groups to continue to seek opportunities to create value, via productivity improvements, waste reduction, new value creating initiatives, etc.
Ensuring Calligo corporate is well informed of assigned projects, by:
Reporting of project status, risks/issues, dependencies etc, through defined communication channels via standardised reporting methods
Ensuring Calligo maintains full compliance to internal compliance for project execution standards by:
Holding project teams accountable to follow defined internal procedures in documentation and reporting methods
Compiling necessary reporting and information packs required for auditors
Perform other related duties as assigned, available and capable

Skills Knowledge and Expertise

Belief in yourself to create value and bring change
Boldness and confidence to communicate fearlessly, balanced with humility and a hunger to learn
1+ years in an IT/Technology centric organization
1+ years in an Operations/Project Management related role/responsibilities
Experience within a PMO is preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire
Strong organizational skills and a meticulous attentiveness to critical details
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI) is essential to enable daily task execution, collaboration, and communication
Knowledge of additional PM tools is helpful, namely: Microsoft Project Online, Microsoft Project Operations (PSA), Financial Force PSA

Benefits

Training and development for career growth
25 Days Holiday (increasing with length of service)
RRSP
Healthcare
Life Assurance
Flexible working
Calligo transforms data into businesses’ most lucrative asset. We combine great minds in data science, privacy, security and engineering with leading machine learning, data analytics and cloud platforms to support the operational, customer-centric and revenue-generation aspirations of some of the world's most ambitious and progressive organizations.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer, CTPS - FPR
Desc:
1) Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Engineering or a related field of study 
 
 2)Demonstrated success leading project/product delivery for large, cross functional programs 
 
 3) Demonstrated record of partnering with and influencing cross-functional teams. Experience working with engineering teams to define, scope and prioritize product requirements 
 
 Job summary 
 Have you ever thought about what it takes to detect and prevent fraudulent activity among hundreds of millions of eCommerce transactions across the globe? What would you do to increase trust in an online marketplace where millions of buyers and sellers transact? How would you build systems that evolve over time to proactively identify and neutralize new and growing fraud threats? 
 
 Do you enjoy working in an entrepreneurial, fast paced environment, solving complex problems and delivering innovative solutions? Do you like to innovate and simplify? 
 
 Our mission in Customer Trust and Partner Support (CTPS) is to make Amazon.com the safest place to transact online. CTPS safeguards every financial transaction across all Amazon sites, while striving to ensure that these efforts are transparent to our legitimate customers. As such, CTPS designs and builds the software systems, risk models and operational processes that minimize risk and maximize trust in Amazon.com. 
 
 As a BIE in CTPS, you will be responsible for modeling forecasting problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, machine learning, algorithmic, data mining and visualization techniques. You will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to analyse forecast variances, identify opportunities to improve operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. The candidate should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and present the insights in concise and effective manner. Additionally, the candidate should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business. 
 
 You will be responsible for analyzing and identify specific instances of risk, broader risk trends and points of customer friction, developing scalable solutions for prevention. You will need to collaborate effectively with business and within CTPS and cross-functional teams to solve problems, create operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. You should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources, and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and proactively present new insights in concise and effective manner. In addition you will be responsible for building a robust set of operational and business metrics and will utilize metrics to determine improvement opportunities. 
 
 You should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical and technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business. 
 
 1) Master’s degree in business, engineering or a related field. 
 
 2) Experience in building customer-facing ML products 
 Excellent analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases 
 
 3) Experience working with large data sets, databases, and cloud-based storage 
 
 4) The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess software design and development and/or IT and networking implementation/consulting experience 
 
 Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Consulting
Desc:
Type: Permanent/Full-time/Remote work
Location: e-Office Environment
Compensation: Based Salary to commensurate with experience + Individual Bonus + 4 weeks’ vacation + Benefits Package, Health and Dental, 100% Employer Paid Premiums + Pension Plan 6% Employer Matching + Paid Annual Corporate Vacation & More.
Position Overview:
Our Technical Consultants who focus on Business Intelligence Reporting work directly with c-suite Finance, IT, and Operations personnel in law firms to customize, develop, and implement industry leading BI reports. Our BI reports provide fresh data that give clear insight into a firm’s operation. This data propels our clients towards streamlining internal processes which awards them with a strong competitive advantage in their market. As the Manager, you will oversee client projects for the BI Consulting Team as well as be the technical lead for your own projects where you will take a customer centric approach while applying customized, innovative and quality technical solutions from requirements gathering to go live implementations. You will work closely with the Director of BI Consulting, Technical Consultants, Project Managers as well as our Innovation Team and/or Managing Partners. This role will require remote management of Consultants, Clients and respective projects.
Responsibilities:
Provide ongoing support to a team of experienced Business Intelligence Consultants.
Work closely with BI Consultants to ensure smooth facilitation of BI client projects.
Handle escalations/questions from consultants and clients on Business Intelligence reporting.
Lead consultation with law firm clients to gather technical project requirements.
Provide ongoing support and training on reporting tools that interact with Elite 3E and Aderant to clients.
Customize and configure applications to agreed requirement specifications.
Design, develop and document technical solutions in 3E and Aderant.
Assist with the development and execution of technical solutions with a remote project team.
Analyze client requirements and provide project quotes.
Train end users and customer development staff in the functionality of products.
Work with Division Director and HR on planning staffing levels and recruitment.
Assist Division Director with ongoing coaching, mentorship and skills development of team.
Required Experience:
7+ years of experience performing Business Analysis – requirement gathering and documentation
7+ years of experience in an IT, Software Development, or Consulting role
Minimum 1+ years’ experience in a leadership capacity.
Strong expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) Team Skills:
PowerBI: Dashboard Design, Visualization and Development; Security and Administration
MDAX and Tabular Model
SSRS – SQL Server Reporting Services: SSRS Report Builder: Paginated Reports; Drill Down and Drill through, SSRS Reports Server Configuration and Management, T-SQL, SQL Server
PowerQuery/PowerPivot
Proven experience of familiarity with performing query optimization and data validation.
Hands on experience with other reporting tools – Business Objects, Crystal Reports, Tableau and/or TM1
Must possess Advanced Excel skills
University Degree in Information Technology, Software Development or a Business Degree with a certification in IT or Software Development.
Working Conditions:
25% Travel to the US &/or Canada
75% working from home remote office
Datolite Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for this role will be considered; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted
What we offer
Opportunity to join a growing technology consulting firm.
Competitive compensation packages.
Incentive programs based on achievements.
Flexibility of working from remote location or home office.
Competitive total benefits package.

Title: Project Coordinator/Business Analyst
Desc:
CTC006681 : Project Coordinator/Business Analyst

Location : Montreal, Quebec

Field : BA
Position Type : Contract Starting : April 21, 2022

Ending : October 21, 2022

Resources Required : 1

Position Description

The Planning and Strategy is a fast paced and dynamic team within the Network and Technology organization. Specifically, the planning and strategy team is responsible for the fast-paced delivery of strategies, the setting of executive targets and the reporting to measure against them. We are also accountable for long-term planning to enable the organization to remain successful in a highly competitive environment.
Job Duties/Accountabilities:
The Project Coordinator/Project Manager will join the team and will assume overall responsibility for the following:
Working collaboratively with a variety of stakeholders, internal departments and vendors to coordinate the collection and digestion of complex data
Synthetizing large amounts of data and identifying trends, potentials risks and developing remediation plans
Developing and maintaining repeatable reporting for various programs, building summary views and executive-level slides and IT dashboards
Managing incoming requests, tracking and coordinating requests for time-sensitive reporting
Managing a high rate of change within constrained timelines in a very fast-paced environment
Facilitating multi-domain/stakeholder calls and proactively managing action registers in a timely fashion
Working with global teams and across overlapping time zones
Working occasional weekends and evenings as required
Providing relevant and high quality project governance and communication to sponsors, executives and project team members, including key project milestones, weekly status reports, action registers, and risk assessments/contingency plans.
Responding to issues and managing the customer’s expectations
Managing and tracking budget activities
Driving innovation and simplicity - identifying opportunities and drive process improvements, standardization, and enablers to gain efficiencies
Critical Qualifications/Competencies:
A minimum 3 years of Project Coordinator or Business Analyst experience
Very strong skills and high level of experience in Excel and Powerpoint
Very strong organization skills, time management, and very high attention to detail
Very strong ability to manage multiple parallel streams of work
Very strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong ability to be responsive in a timely fashion and complete deliverables in the face of multiple priorities and challenging timelines
Strong negotiation and facilitation skills
Ability to work independently as well as in a team setting; a self motivator
Proven ability to manage fast-paced projects with a significant amount of change
Ability to manage ambiguity, uncertainty and changing priorities
Preferred Qualifications /Competencies:
Knowledge of project management methodology and best practices, proficiency using MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), proven ability to build automated IT dashboards and strong understanding of the Project Life Cycle. Formal project management training is desirable; PMI/PMP certification is not required but is considered an asset.
Experience in Information Technology, along with a background knowledge of the telecommunications industry
Knowledge and understanding of Client’s network, systems, IT and Operations processes
Knowledge of Client’s residential services products
Knowledge and experience in building dashboards and executive level PPT slides
Working Conditions:
Ability to efficiently work in virtual and co-located teams, handling multiple projects, a high rate of change with significant time sensitivity and aggressive timelines
Fast paced working environment interfacing with a myriad of stakeholders
Available to work occasional weekends and evenings as required
Ability to work with global teams and across overlapping time zones

Title: Sales Analyst
Desc:
A REGULAR DAY AT WORK (ESSENTIAL DUTIES):
For us going to work every day has an even greater purpose than putting the latest product or technology on the market. It’s about improving the everyday lives of millions. By being sustainable and open to new ideas we can push the boundaries of cooking, cleaning, and wellbeing at home. But to keep doing so, we need more people who want to innovate and re-imagine what life at home can be.
Play a critical role in our sales builder analyst team supporting and enabling sales and profit improvement in the contract sales channel. This individual will utilize strong business understanding and analytical skills to drive key business decisions supporting performance targets. This position requires proven relationship management, strategic thinking, multi-level communication abilities, excellent presentation skills, and a high degree of organization.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyzing sales leads, data and history while identifying trends and supporting sales leadership in decisions related to this data.
Perform analysis and create dashboards to help identify areas of improvement and opportunities.
Assess and provide solutions to recurring scenarios for the contract team, identifying problems in existing processes, systems, and relationships to create process improvement and opportunities to streamline, update, or build from new.
Collaborate with marketing on the design and development of sales tools for sales enablement.
Review content and how it is communicated to the sales team ensuring efficiency and expediency in new updates, features, and initiatives.
Develop key business presentations for regular business reviews and product presentations.
Support the organization of marketing materials, programs, and events that effectively communicate, promote, and differentiate Frigidaire and Electrolux focusing on their design, performance, quality, and feature set, to trade partners, designers, builder specifiers and consumers.
Manage digital and social assets with customers on request.
Manage the spiff process for the Contract Channel.
Coordinate and control pricing activity and project quotes.
WHO YOU ARE:
With a number of projects running simultaneously, flexibility and agility are essential.
With an eye for detail and the ability to interpret complex data, you can also translate this into meaningful, useful information that informs decision-making.
Whether face-to-face or on the phone, you can communicate plans and articulate your ideas with colleagues and customers at all levels.
You know your stuff and can articulate it well; building a case that is sound and people can buy into.
For you, every challenge offers opportunity and potential. You just have to find it.
With lots of initiative, you always have something to do and thrive on being productive.
We employ great people from a wide variety of backgrounds – not just because it’s the right thing to do, but also because we believe that diverse perspectives make our business stronger and more innovative. If you share our values, come find your place in our global community. Meet us on @lifeatelectrolux and career.electroluxgroup.com to learn more.
Minimum Qualification
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree in business, finance preferred.
2+ years of experience supporting internal customers with data, analysis, and reporting.
Strong client services experience.
Strong budget management and analytical skills.
Excellent presentation and public speaking skills.
Demonstrated track record of influencing priorities and motivating cross-functional partners for support.
Must be action orientated and responsive in a very fast paced environment.
Must have a full knowledge of PowerPoint, Excel, and Word.
A high degree of organization is a mandatory.

Title: Quality Assurance Analyst (Bilingual)
Desc:
Company Description
   ISAAC partners with North American fleets to provide a user-friendly solution that simplifies trucking. Focused 100% on the trucking industry, we help carriers overcome challenges, while boosting driver happiness. With proven system reliability and system integration capabilities driven by our open platform, our solution helps your drivers and back-office team work smoothly.
 For more information, visit www.isaacinstruments.com.



  Job Description
   As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will participate in the improvement of quality and the maintenance of ISAAC Instruments’ telemetry software. Your main responsibilities include implementing and applying efficient testing methods to ensure that all the products meet the established quality standards and analyzing various change requests. You will report to the Vice-President R & D.
 Applications to be maintained:

 Data analysis application
 Real-time communication application with recorders for vehicle tracking
 Distributed client/server fleet management application
 SOA type application using .NET platform

 Responsibilities

 Developing, improving, performing and automating tests and validation tools
 Documenting test plans
 Resolving issues related to testing and developed tools
 Installing, configuring and testing new software iterations and updates
 Analyzing, identifying causes, and sorting bugs
 Documenting test procedures to be executed by fellow team members
 Identifying and addressing system performance issues




  Qualifications
  

 Bachelor’s degree in computer science or software engineering, or any other training combined with relevant working experience
 1 to 3 years’ experience in quality assurance, in a software development or high-tech company, or relevant working experience
 Excellent knowledge of the Windows environment
 Investigative mind and problem solving skills
 Ability to work in a team setting
 Strong communication skills
 Good organisational skills
 Attention to detail

 Assets

 Knowledge of automated test programming (ex.: C#, Windows, PowerShell, Postman)
 Knowledge of .NET Framework 4.0+ and of C# language

 Additional Information
   Collaborators are at the center of ISAAC’s interests and values. This explains the numerous benefits of working at ISAAC, namely:

 varied career opportunities
 a stimulating work environment focused on innovation
 enthusiastic and collaborative teams
 competitive salaries and benefits promoting work-life balance: a complete group insurance plan, group RRSP, an EAP, flexible hours, 4 weeks of vacation, etc
 various social activities and free snacks every day

Title: Senior Business Analyst, BCEHS Transformation Office
Desc:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.


The Senior Business Analyst performs complex research and analysis to support operations of clinical and provincial programs of the BCEHS. This role will be engaged in multiple initiatives, and will be responsible for project planning, business requirements gathering (i.e. data, clinical workflow/business process and functional needs) and supporting the execution of projects and change management.

What you bring

A level of education, training, and experience equivalent to a Master’s degree in Business, Health Informatics, or a related discipline plus a minimum of five (5) years’ recent related experience including three (3) years in a team lead role.

Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology.
Demonstrated experience organizing and writing application related documentation and proposals.
Ability to understand and clearly relate technical information to internal and external members of the organization.
Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem solving environment, utilizing your advanced critical thinking capabilities.
Understands business analysis and project management methodology.
Superior ability in presentation, facilitation, negotiation and issue management/escalation.
Ability to facilitate and encourage cooperation between diverse operational groups and skill sets.
Strong skills and experience in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and MS Project, Access), SharePoint and Visio, Crystal reports and other Business Intelligence Tools.
Experience with main stream project planning software and tools preferred.


What we bring


Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.

Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.

Job Type: Regular Full-Time
Location: 2955 Virtual Way, Vancouver BC V5M 4X6
Hours of Work: 08:00-16:00 Monday-Friday
Requisition #: 124769E


What we do


BC Emergency Health Services (BCEHS) provides provincial emergency medical care and patient transfer services.


Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services


PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Title: Sr SEO Analyst (Remote)
Desc: A Little Bit About Us: We are a growing global technology company that is looking to reinvent the way organizations build Trust in People with technology and AI-backed background checks. We are proud to share that we recently secured 43 million in funding, were named one of Canada’s Companies-to-Watch in Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50™ Awards, and are on track to become one of Canada’s fastest-growing start-ups.Who are Certonians?We are soccer players, DIY creators, spicy-food lovers, karaoke lovers, wine connoisseurs, and so much more! We are a team of 150+ people currently living the dream at Certn and are looking for more team members to level us up. If you are excited about working with a group that values accountability, working synergistically with one another, being inclusive of different perspectives, and not being an a$$hole - aka approaching all solutions & problems with compassion and empathy - we want to hear from you!The Opportunity: We are looking for a Sr SEO Analyst to expand our growing Marketing team! Reporting to Director, Growth Marketing you will be responsible for analyzing, reviewing and implementing websites and content that is optimized to increase traffic organically from search engines.Success in the role requires someone with an understanding of the different levers of SEO, a savvy mind for core marketing principles and an ability to think big picture.As our Sr SEO Analyst, you will: Develop on-page and off-page optimization strategies that increase Certn and our subsidiaries website SERPs globallyThe Sr SEO Analyst will work closely with the Sr PPC Analyst to execute tests, collect and analyze data and results, identify trends and insights, in order to achieve maximum ROIClosely collaborate with digital development teams to ensure SEO best practices are properly followed throughout the website; including site architecture, proper silo structure, and ability to advise development teams on effective site migrations that maintain SEO standings.Work with content and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content marketing.Take responsibility for onsite SEO implementations. As well as leading and lagging SEO kpi reporting and attribution.In-depth understanding of technical SEO monitoring and execution (audits & fixes), internal link structures, offsite link-building and digital PR. Run site speed and performance audits as needed, with knowledge of core web vitals.Perform ongoing keyword research, discovery and optimization for new SEO keywords to use throughout the company websites and marketing executions. Including pillar content, video and image SEO strategies.Create and execute link building strategy, as well as link profile management, penalty avoidance and recovery strategies.Determine measurable goals that demonstrate improvement in marketing efforts. Monitor daily performance metrics with SEO tools including, but not limited to Google Analytics, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog and GSCAbility to manage SEO-relevant scripts and codes through Google Tag Manager, analytics and conversion tracking.We're hoping you'll bring: A thirst for new: An SEO Specialist will have in-depth knowledge of cluster based keyword research, SEO copywriting and the behaviours of search engines. SEO is an ever-changing landscape, so our SEO specialist needs to be continuously learning and evolving.Communication skills: SEO involves a number of different areas of the organization – from marketing to product, and often the results can be slower burn. This is where the upside and importance of SEO needs clear communication to the business.Adaptability: Google and SEO algorithms change constantly. Complacency is the death of great SEO…you need to be able to move with change, and change our strategy and content accordingly.Ownership: Yes, SEO has many stakeholders but we are looking for someone to join and immediately establish themselves as the SEO leader for the organization. In order to achieve this you need domain expertise, team work and patience.Why Certn?Our goal is to make sure Certn to be the best place for you to work. That means we are consistently asking for your feedback, researching best practices, and implementing new programs and changes in the way we work so that we can each walk away every day feeling proud to work here!Some of the benefits you can expect at Certn are...4 weeks of paid vacation12 wellness daysExtensive health benefitsFamily support program (including support for new parents and caregivers)Remote-first and supports flexible remote arrangementsGreen transportation allowanceFitness & wellness allowanceWork from home allowanceProfessional development budgetAnd a few more goodies!Does this role sound like it was made for you, yet you don’t check every box?We value diversity in our teams’ experience. Whatever your background, experience, ethnicity, physical ability, sexual orientation, race, and gender is, we want to hear from you! We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse environment for all employees from all walks of life. One of our corporate goals is to build an environment that will be the best place for you to work and spend your time. To accomplish that, we know we need to develop a diverse team where everyone feels included and where a variety of voices are heard.*If you have a disability that requires accommodation during any stage of our recruitment process, please let us know how we can best assist you*About CertnWe’re changing the way background checks are done. Easily manage your entire screening process- from customizing packages, paying for only what you need, and tracking status updates – with Certn’s powerful all-in-one platform and proprietary API.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Extended health carePaid time offWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: Business Analyst, Rev Ops PMO
Desc:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Finance and Operations
Job Details
Job Category
Revenue Operations
Job Details
Salesforce is growing at the speed of light, both organically and through acquisitions; we are seeking an experienced employee to join the Revenue Operations Strategy and Enablement team to help our organization manage change and scale with this incredible growth.


This role will be responsible for supporting projects for the global Revenue Operations team to help the organization become more efficient while providing increasing levels of support for the sales organization. The Revenue Operations department is responsible for pricing & product operations, sales operations, sales compensation strategy & operations and corresponding systems enablement functions that are required to support our sales organization.



The Business Analyst collaborates with the Revenue Operations business teams and IT teams to analyze root causes, improve processes, define problems, and develop business requirements, as-is, and to-be process documentation and success metrics. Additionally, the BA coordinates end-to-end UAT business cycles from planning/strategy through to execution and retrospectives. As part of supporting the broader PMO maturity effort, this individual would create collateral for the center of excellence organization to ensure consistent program and project management across Revenue Operations.


Responsibilities:
Perform root cause and business process analysis, leverage data to substantiate KPIs/ROIs
Document business requirements, including business value and stakeholder alignment, as-is and to-be process documentation
Participate in prioritization process and perform program/project intakes into the Revnue Operations Organization
Liaise regularly with IT Product Owners, BSAs, global business process owners, and other organizations to drive process and system solutions
Plan and lead UAT business cycles, including creation of coverage matrices, test script documentation, test execution logisitics, tracking and reporting
Manage the delivery of multiple projects concurrently that have moderate to high levels of business or technical complexity and risk
Respond to problems, prioritize correctly, systematically gather information, seek input from others, develop accurate conclusions from findings, and make timely decisions to prioritize and adapt to change
Support Project Lead to drive the overall program plans, resolve ad hoc action items and ensure the smooth delivery of the business solution and all deliverables
Support the Center of Excellence organization by creating deliverables that mature the organizational capabilities in Program/Project management.

Requirements:
4+ years of relevant experience elsewhere in business process analysis, requirements, design, and quality
Experience in an environment with automated sales commission payments, CRM, sales alignment, sales crediting, and quote to cash processes; preferably in the enterprise software industry
Demonstrated ability to improve the efficiency of business processes with both technology and process improvement methodologies.
Experience working with large, complex projects; familiar with agile methodologies and principles
Ability to work with deadlines and in a fast-paced environment
Experience with Salesforce
Familiarity with Project Management Best practices or OPM3 assessments preferred
Results Oriented – able to define goals and metrics, develop actionable plans, and manage work to achieve desired outcomes. Has a sense of urgency and fosters the same in others.
Change Oriented – works effectively in the face of ambiguity, shifting priorities, and rapid change. Maintains a positive outlook in difficult situations.
Problem Solving – able to assess situations and make decisions in a systematic and decisive manner. Effectively uses data as a tool for decisions, innovates and challenges the status quo.
Communications – Excellent spoken and written communication skills including receptive listening skills and ability to present complex ideas in a concise and objective manner in a variety of settings and styles. Comfortable and experienced in presenting to senior level project stakeholders and sponsors, as well as to large audiences.
Teamwork – acts as a catalyst for formulating a team-oriented environment to achieve common goals. Has ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with virtual and global cross functional team members.
Accountability – assumes ownership for achieving personal and team goals.
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .

Title: Software Engineer - Business Intelligence Platform
Desc:
Calabrio is looking for a Software Engineer! Our Vancouver-based Business Intelligence Platform team, which builds software that is part of Calabrio’s contact center suite, is looking for an Engineer to help Calabrio get to the next level by designing, implementing, and creating features that work in a SAAS based, multi-tenant, secure cloud environment. You will create innovative software in a dynamic and rewarding environment working with product and development teams in Vancouver, Minneapolis and Stockholm that will challenge your skills and help you reach the next level of your career.
What you’ll be doing:
Collaborate, learn and create in an engaging, dynamic and rewarding environment with people whose passion for creating outstanding software matches yours.
Implement REST-based web services in a Java platform using microservices, Java EE and supporting data structures
Build high availability, asynchronous and message-based services using AWS
Maintain and enhance GWT-based front ends
Creating robust continuous integration and deployment infrastructure
Requirements
MUST HAVES:
Passion for agile development practices such as continuous delivery, continuous integration, unit testing and test driven development
Skilled in backend application development: Java, REST APIs, JSON, database programming fundamentals, etc.
Experience with distributed version control systems and cloud based build tools
Experience working in Kanban/Agile and DevOps environments
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail
NICE TO HAVES:
Experience with any of the below tools and technologies is a major plus!
AWS (e.g. CloudFormation, EC2, Elasticsearch)
Containers (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)
Continuous Integration tools including Jenkins and Artifactory
Microservices (e.g. Quarkus, Dropwizard, Spring Boot, Swagger)
RabbitMQ, Kafka
Benefits
Calabrio People are: Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent
What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and creative. We've built a company culture where you’ll feel motivated and truly excited to come to work. Calabrio is driven by the diversity of our talented team members who come from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. As an equal opportunity employer, we always consider and embrace ALL individuals including what makes them unique. We believe our team members should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of accomplishment.
About Calabrio:
Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform. For you, that means working on high-performing innovative teams that combine their incredible ideas in one incredible company.
Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements).
Awards & Accolades:
Calabrio has 300 Global Partners, more than 2.25 million agents, and over 7,000 customers worldwide. We’ve been doing this for more than two decades and have been recognized by leading independent third parties such as Gartner, Forrester, and G2 Crowd as a leader and visionary. Thanks to the hard work and dedication of every Calabrio team member, we have been recognized by the Star Tribune Top Workplace for 8 years in a row, #20 on the 2020 Fast 50 list, named one of BC’s Top Employers for 2021 and recognized as a top 50 fast-growth company by Minneapolis/St Paul Business Journal.
Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer - 336558
Senior Business Analyst - Payments
Desc:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Canadian Payments Platform & Capabilities Team, is part of Enterprise Payments (serving both Canada and the US), which is within TD's Digital Strategy & Payments organization. The Team is responsible for developing and maintaining the near-term strategy, transformation, and execution of TD's Payments roadmap. We focus on initiatives that create business value, improve customer experience, and de-risk the payments made by Canadians. Collectively, these initiatives will enable TD's Next Generation Payments Platform which will allow any customer (business to retail) to make any payment (E-Transfer on Real-Time-Rails, Electronic Funds Transfer, Wires, etc.) to anywhere (domestic or international) at any time (safely and securely).

We work closely with the Lines of Business (Personal Banking, Business Banking, Corporate Commercial) to collect, prioritize, shape, and execute their needs. We also work closely with Digital, Marketing, Fraud, GAML, and Risk to ensure we are building the most convenient and safe payments products for our customers.
Job Description
Reporting to the AVP, International Payments, the successful candidate will play a critical role in the management and delivery of business analysis activities on complex, transformational, cross-functional project(s) for Enterprise Payments, such as Mobile Wallets, eCommerce, and other. The primary responsibilities of the Senior Business Analyst include, but are not limited to, the following:
Leadership of the end-to-end business requirements throughout the lifecycle of the project, working collaboratively with stakeholders from lines of business, technology, operations, and governance & control, always keeping a customer-centric focus
Proactive identification and management of requirement risks, issues, assumptions, dependencies, and constraints
Contribution to Change Management deliverables (stakeholder analysis, gap analysis, change planning, etc.) to ensure readiness of our customers, colleagues, and cross-functional stakeholder groups
Application of a variety of business analysis tools and techniques to solicit requirements and ensure alignment with business and Enterprise Payments' needs and strategies
Adherence to Enterprise Project Management governance and controls to ensure requirement deliverables meet best practices and standards
Collaboration with technology partners, providing recommendations towards system requirements and design to ensure alignment to business requirements
Contribution to Quality Assurance activities by supporting development of test strategies, test plans and test scenarios; and active participation in assessment and resolution of testing defects
Contribution to team development of skills and capabilities through mentorship of colleagues by sharing knowledge and experiences
Fostering a collaborative team environment by actively participating in team meetings and reward & recognition programs
Contribution to a positive work environment by embracing diversity in the workplace and supporting and proudly representing TD in the community
Job Requirements
Advanced knowledge of business analysis, project delivery practices and standards across the project life-cycle
4 - 5 years of experience in business analysis (BA accreditation is an asset)
Proven experience in successful requirements delivery for large, complex, multi-stakeholder programs/projects
Strong verbal/written communication, collaboration, and facilitation skills, adapting style and technique to a diverse audience
Prior experience in a financial institution (payments-focused role is an asset)
Strong leadership with a demonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with all levels
Prior experience in Agile requirements delivery is an asset
Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
Skill in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Business Sys. Analyst (remote)
Desc:
Req ID: 187070

NTT DATA Services strives to hire exceptional, innovative and passionate individuals who want to grow with us. If you want to be part of an inclusive, adaptable, and forward-thinking organization, apply now.

We are currently seeking a Business Sys. Analyst (remote) to join our team in Halifax, Nova Scotia OR Toronto, Ontario (CA-ON), Canada (CA).

Position Responsibilities:

Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, tasks, and a workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: (Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, GUI, Screen, and Interface designs)
Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow.
Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams.
Analyzes business and user needs, documents requirements, and revises existing system logic difficulties.
Implement systems applications and tests end-user processes.
Creates/delivers correspondence, presentations, and other materials for end-user training.
Responds to client inquiries involving application questions.
Develops customized queries and reports utilizing complex table matrices.
Interacts with clients, internal and external, acting as a key liaison between business and technology areas.
Documents business rules / functional requirements to support system enhancements.
Oversees external product vendors' performance and collaborates on future system enhancements.

Requirements:

Experience or interest in being a Business Systems Analyst
University Degree in Information Systems; Computer Science; Business or Similar Related programs.
Understanding of IT Systems environment
Experience or knowledge within a Healthcare/Insurance environment is nice to have
Ability to work independently with users to define concepts and under the direction of project managers
Analytical and product management skills are required, including an understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into the application and operational requirements.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, of executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
#LI-NAM

INDHCLSMC

NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.

NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Title: Senior Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
Desc:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
 We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
 Position Title: Senior Analyst, Risk & Controls (IT Audit)
 Team and Location: Risk & Controls – Calgary, AB or Remote
 Position Summary:
 Reporting to the Manager, Risk and Controls (IT Audit), the Senior Analyst will assist with the IT compliance activities, across Parkland’s various businesses and operations, including IT, business transformation and integration initiatives.
 The successful candidate will bring a commercially focused, value-add, risk management mindset and demonstrate a track record of ‘thinking outside of the box’ and driving significant innovation in the delivery of compliance audits.
 Key Responsibilities:

 Assist with developing and maintaining the IT Risk Assessment and scoping for Parkland; including identifying areas where compliance audits should focus.
 Execute Parkland’s IT compliance (C-SOX and SOX) program including execution of walkthroughs and tests of design and operational effectiveness of IT controls. These include:
    
 Assist with annual and ongoing IT compliance scoping to identify any changes to the systems, applications, and automated controls considered to be in-scope for the current fiscal year.
 Prepare clear, concise, appropriately referenced work papers to document test procedures performed and conclusion drawn.
 Pre and post- implementation reviews of system implementations or enhancements.
 Coordinate compliance program testing IT controls with external audit IT team members, control owners, managers and executive Management.
 Evaluate IT control deficiencies for impact and perform root cause analysis to determine appropriate Management actions.
 Monitor Management’s remediation efforts to closure, including review of supporting evidence.
 Support initiatives to improve controls, make processes more efficient, effective, and/or reduce cycle time for IT compliance.
 Perform various other reviews of IT management policies and procedures such as change management, business continuity planning/ disaster recovery and information security to ensure that controls surrounding these processes are adequate.

 Bring best practices and strong IT Controls methodology to help the department develop a “best in class” practice.
 Assist with the implementation of data analytical tools to perform sampling, analyze data to improve audit and business efficiency and effectiveness, (including for risk assessments).
 Support the maturation of IT Compliance program across the organization.
 The team is to be regarded as a business partner when reviewing and developing procedures for the business. Policy and procedure research and development is required as well as review and recommending refinements.

 Qualifications and Skills:

 3 to 5 years of relevant C-SOX and SOX IT Controls experience.
 Certified Information System Auditor (CISA) with Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) is considered an asset.
 Excellent knowledge and experience of IT General Controls across domains such as access, change management, operations, application controls and reports testing.
 Experience with application of data analytics and visualization (preferred).
 Ability to build relationships with business customers.
 Ability to manage confidential content.
 Strong attention to detail and follow-up.
 Ability to work under pressure, resolve problems and make decisions quickly and effectively, using a strong sense of self confidence.
 Project management skills including the ability to work on various projects and prioritize accordingly.
 Moderate knowledge of accounting practices (preferred).
 High energy: Self-motivated with the ability to effectively manage concurrent projects.

 We Offer: 

Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
 A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
 A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
 Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
 An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
 In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
 Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
 A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.

 Please note:

 Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
 Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
 Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Project Operations Analyst / PMO Analyst / PSA Analyst
Desc:
Calligo is an award-winning managed data services provider. It has a global track record in improving organizations' productivity & profitability by making their data more available, secure and safe. The right candidate will be excited to work in a dynamic & collaborative value-centric technology company.

Within Calligo, the Project Management Office, is accountable to ensure the successful completion of projects against business objectives. The role ensures project execution happens with a focus on value generation, to ensure we are biasing towards action, have clear distribution of responsibilities on the project, are following the desired governance framework, providing necessary reporting and documentation to meet audit compliance standards, and providing reporting and communication to enable broader alignment and business integration.
Key Responsibilities

Help ensure Resource/Project management systems are kept up to date, with accurate information based on plans - both for pipeline projects (being setup by the Sales/Commercial team), and also ensuring that delivery teams / project leads are managing projects in accordance with defined expectations. These duties would include:
Ensuring pipeline projects plans are regularly reviewed and updates being made in alignment with commercial and pre-sales stakeholders
Ensuring timecards are being completed (submitted & approved) on time each week and at month end
Ensuring project status and other information needed is being regularly captured by the Project Leads
Ensuring the Executive and other Leads in the business are receiving the necessary reporting from the planning systems via the PowerBI reports, and updates to the systems and reporting are being delivered
Ensuring the system (workflows, fields etc) is continually being improved to maximize the value we receive from it, whilst reducing/removing unnecessary processes and data to create efficiency
Self-managing one’s time to maximize your personal contribution to the business, with a lens of profit-orientated PMO, including activities such as:
Continuous learning to increase one’s personal productivity, in terms of new tools and methods, or new business concepts or frameworks
Critically reflecting on one’s personal schedule, activities, and considering how to optimize and reduce waste via outdated or unnecessary meetings and activities
Critically reflecting on activities and initiatives, to understand how they will generate more customer value, and what the true customer need is
Collaborating with adjacent stakeholder groups to continue to seek opportunities to create value, via productivity improvements, waste reduction, new value creating initiatives, etc.
Ensuring Calligo corporate is well informed of assigned projects, by:
Reporting of project status, risks/issues, dependencies etc, through defined communication channels via standardised reporting methods
Ensuring Calligo maintains full compliance to internal compliance for project execution standards by:
Holding project teams accountable to follow defined internal procedures in documentation and reporting methods
Compiling necessary reporting and information packs required for auditors
Perform other related duties as assigned, available and capable

Skills Knowledge and Expertise

Belief in yourself to create value and bring change
Boldness and confidence to communicate fearlessly, balanced with humility and a hunger to learn
1+ years in an IT/Technology centric organization
1+ years in an Operations/Project Management related role/responsibilities
Experience within a PMO is preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire
Strong organizational skills and a meticulous attentiveness to critical details
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI) is essential to enable daily task execution, collaboration, and communication
Knowledge of additional PM tools is helpful, namely: Microsoft Project Online, Microsoft Project Operations (PSA), Financial Force PSA

Benefits

Training and development for career growth
25 Days Holiday (increasing with length of service)
RRSP
Healthcare
Life Assurance
Flexible working
Calligo transforms data into businesses’ most lucrative asset. We combine great minds in data science, privacy, security and engineering with leading machine learning, data analytics and cloud platforms to support the operational, customer-centric and revenue-generation aspirations of some of the world's most ambitious and progressive organizations.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer, CTPS - FPR
Desc:
1) Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Engineering or a related field of study 
 
 2)Demonstrated success leading project/product delivery for large, cross functional programs 
 
 3) Demonstrated record of partnering with and influencing cross-functional teams. Experience working with engineering teams to define, scope and prioritize product requirements 
 
 Job summary 
 Have you ever thought about what it takes to detect and prevent fraudulent activity among hundreds of millions of eCommerce transactions across the globe? What would you do to increase trust in an online marketplace where millions of buyers and sellers transact? How would you build systems that evolve over time to proactively identify and neutralize new and growing fraud threats? 
 
 Do you enjoy working in an entrepreneurial, fast paced environment, solving complex problems and delivering innovative solutions? Do you like to innovate and simplify? 
 
 Our mission in Customer Trust and Partner Support (CTPS) is to make Amazon.com the safest place to transact online. CTPS safeguards every financial transaction across all Amazon sites, while striving to ensure that these efforts are transparent to our legitimate customers. As such, CTPS designs and builds the software systems, risk models and operational processes that minimize risk and maximize trust in Amazon.com. 
 
 As a BIE in CTPS, you will be responsible for modeling forecasting problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, machine learning, algorithmic, data mining and visualization techniques. You will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to analyse forecast variances, identify opportunities to improve operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. The candidate should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and present the insights in concise and effective manner. Additionally, the candidate should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business. 
 
 You will be responsible for analyzing and identify specific instances of risk, broader risk trends and points of customer friction, developing scalable solutions for prevention. You will need to collaborate effectively with business and within CTPS and cross-functional teams to solve problems, create operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. You should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources, and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and proactively present new insights in concise and effective manner. In addition you will be responsible for building a robust set of operational and business metrics and will utilize metrics to determine improvement opportunities. 
 
 You should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical and technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business. 
 
 1) Master’s degree in business, engineering or a related field. 
 
 2) Experience in building customer-facing ML products 
 Excellent analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases 
 
 3) Experience working with large data sets, databases, and cloud-based storage 
 
 4) The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess software design and development and/or IT and networking implementation/consulting experience 
 
 Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Consulting
Desc:
Type: Permanent/Full-time/Remote work
Location: e-Office Environment
Compensation: Based Salary to commensurate with experience + Individual Bonus + 4 weeks’ vacation + Benefits Package, Health and Dental, 100% Employer Paid Premiums + Pension Plan 6% Employer Matching + Paid Annual Corporate Vacation & More.
Position Overview:
Our Technical Consultants who focus on Business Intelligence Reporting work directly with c-suite Finance, IT, and Operations personnel in law firms to customize, develop, and implement industry leading BI reports. Our BI reports provide fresh data that give clear insight into a firm’s operation. This data propels our clients towards streamlining internal processes which awards them with a strong competitive advantage in their market. As the Manager, you will oversee client projects for the BI Consulting Team as well as be the technical lead for your own projects where you will take a customer centric approach while applying customized, innovative and quality technical solutions from requirements gathering to go live implementations. You will work closely with the Director of BI Consulting, Technical Consultants, Project Managers as well as our Innovation Team and/or Managing Partners. This role will require remote management of Consultants, Clients and respective projects.
Responsibilities:
Provide ongoing support to a team of experienced Business Intelligence Consultants.
Work closely with BI Consultants to ensure smooth facilitation of BI client projects.
Handle escalations/questions from consultants and clients on Business Intelligence reporting.
Lead consultation with law firm clients to gather technical project requirements.
Provide ongoing support and training on reporting tools that interact with Elite 3E and Aderant to clients.
Customize and configure applications to agreed requirement specifications.
Design, develop and document technical solutions in 3E and Aderant.
Assist with the development and execution of technical solutions with a remote project team.
Analyze client requirements and provide project quotes.
Train end users and customer development staff in the functionality of products.
Work with Division Director and HR on planning staffing levels and recruitment.
Assist Division Director with ongoing coaching, mentorship and skills development of team.
Required Experience:
7+ years of experience performing Business Analysis – requirement gathering and documentation
7+ years of experience in an IT, Software Development, or Consulting role
Minimum 1+ years’ experience in a leadership capacity.
Strong expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) Team Skills:
PowerBI: Dashboard Design, Visualization and Development; Security and Administration
MDAX and Tabular Model
SSRS – SQL Server Reporting Services: SSRS Report Builder: Paginated Reports; Drill Down and Drill through, SSRS Reports Server Configuration and Management, T-SQL, SQL Server
PowerQuery/PowerPivot
Proven experience of familiarity with performing query optimization and data validation.
Hands on experience with other reporting tools – Business Objects, Crystal Reports, Tableau and/or TM1
Must possess Advanced Excel skills
University Degree in Information Technology, Software Development or a Business Degree with a certification in IT or Software Development.
Working Conditions:
25% Travel to the US &/or Canada
75% working from home remote office
Datolite Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for this role will be considered; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted
What we offer
Opportunity to join a growing technology consulting firm.
Competitive compensation packages.
Incentive programs based on achievements.
Flexibility of working from remote location or home office.
Competitive total benefits package.
